Reviews.Title: If you simply want more of your memories caught on film...
Reviews.Author: Valeri
Reviews.Content: this camera is for you. This camera does have some great features, some of which I have not even had time to use yet. The main draw, however, (other than the size) is that it is simple and easy to use. There are tons of point and shoot cameras out there, and there is no use being snobby over which one you buy, because they all do pretty much the same thing. This one is great for the price. You could get a nicer camera, but for 90% of the people in the market for a digital camera, this will do what you need and want it to, and more.I use mine mainly for snapshots and spontaneous pictures with friends and the like. However, I do enjoy photography, and I have experience with SLR cameras as well (and I own one). Therefore, I also sometimes take artistic shots. This camera does it all unless you are a professional photographer, in which case, you already know you need a different camera.The size is perfect. This will even fit in small pockets on skinny jeans or whatever. The case I bought with the camera adds some bulk, but the camera is so slim, even the case fits in my pockets comfortably.I use Amazon Student Prime, so shipping is never a hassle. I can't really comment on other shipping speeds. The package was simple, but the camera box protects the camera with styrofoam and cardboard, and the shipping box used inflated plastic bags to keep the camera box safe. Someone would really have to try to damage the camera to manage it.Amazon lists plenty of features of this camera, but here is my list:RECHARGEABLE!Records HD movies with one buttonBig LCD screen on back to help compose pictures in a size you can actually see19 scenes to choose from to assist in getting a better picturePet Focus will find your pet's face and once focused, will shoot the pictureThere are several cool filters like selective coloring, a miniature effect and a fisheye effectIs tiny and lightweightComes in cool colorsThis camera will even warn you if it thinks someone blinked.Bottom line: This camera is what you want. I search for weeks or longer before deciding to buy something, and I chose this camera. For a point and shoot, it has everything you need, and so many things you didn't even know you wanted. Unless you don't actually know what you're looking for, you won't regret buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: Overall a great camera
Reviews.Author: Westoncito
Reviews.Content: This camera pretty much rocks for its price.  I bought this camera because I was in need of a camera update and the cell phone camera on my G2 wasn't cutting it.When I took this think out of the box for the first time I was glad to notice that it's small and thin and fits nicely in my pocket. My old camera was much bulkier and I couldn't carry it in my pocket without a strange looking bulge in my pants that made me look like an idiot.I am not a digital photographer so I bought this camera as more of a point-and-shoot camera.  I wanted a camera that I could snap a quick picture that would have lots of details and look pretty nice without too much photo editing. Normally when I take a picture I am wanting a picture of my friends or myself at a certain event or next to a landmark etc...  So I wanted a camera that would be simple but still take a sweet picture.  I can't tell you how many times I've had people trying to snap a picture for me only to not be able to get my old camera to work right and the picture(s) turn out horribly.  Like I want to load a fuzzy blur up onto my Facebook page.That being said, this camera can also cause difficulties with the technologically retarded.  This camera has to achieve a "focus" before it will snap a picture.  Sometimes you can push down the button trying to take a picture and the "focus" will be off and it won't even snap a photo at all.  For those special individuals, who for some reason are always snapping my photos, this can cause extreme problems with their abilities to be able get the camera to function.Now you may be asking yourself why I would have rated the camera so high and said that it rocks and then ripping it a new one, but I just wanted to let you know the only problem that I have had with it so far.  This camera perhaps is not the easiest camera to use, but if you spend 5 minutes to learn how it works then you will be able to get excellent pictures from it.The camera's picture taking mode basically has 4 different options, Auto mode, Scene mode, Smart portrait, and Subject tracking. In my experience so far with this camera I have noticed that the Auto-mode isn't always perfect.  I may have to take a bunch of pictures, before I can get the picture looking like I want it to look.  To be honest I am a bit picky with my pictures though. Many times when I am having somebody else snap a picture for me that can be quite an annoyance. The Auto-mode definitely works better on landscapes than it does for people (in my opinion).The scene-selector mode is sweet when I am the one taking the picture there are 15+ differing options that optimize the camera for different types of pictures such as: sunset, portrait, pet, beach, party/indoor, etc.  I gave up even trying to teach the technologically handicapped this mode after the 2nd attempt.The mode that has been the most useful for me has been the Smart-portrait mode.  This mode basically finds a couple of people's faces and then focuses the picture on them.  Since the majority of the time I am taking pictures of people I have found this to be an amazing option.  I use this mode for 90% of my pictures.  I get pictures that look amazing and I usually give the camera to other people in this mode although sometimes it won't take a picture and they will have to "refocus" the camera by re-pressing the button.The smart tracking picture mode has honestly not been something that I have needed yet but I suppose it takes pictures of moving objects or something like that.I could ramble on more but I figure that this should be sufficient for now. Overall this camera takes great pictures, they look sweet in print and they are very photoshopable (is that actually a word?)  and look great in print form and also on the web.

Reviews.Title: When In Doubt, Read The Manual...
Reviews.Author: Kricket
Reviews.Content: I received my camera from Amazon this afternoon.  The first shots that I took with it were blurry, just as some of the previous reviews that I read stated they would be.  But then I told myself that Nikon has been making great cameras for many years, so if there was a problem here, it most likely was me, not the camera.  The camera does not come with an owner's manual - just the quick start guide, and that does not give you any details about the various settings.  The complete owner's manual is available on the Nikon site.  Once I read the manual, and found out how to set up the camera so that image stabilization and auto focus worked as they should and other settings did not conflict, everything was great!  If you purchase this camera thinking that it is a simple point and shoot camera, it isn't.  But that does not mean that you cannot take great pictures once you understand the settings.  Also, I should add that I am not a professional photographer - not even close - but I was able to set up this camera so that it takes great pictures.  So if you too are an amateur photographer, don't be afraid to purchase this camera. I am giving this camera four stars instead of five only because I have not had it long enough to explore all the features.

Reviews.Title: Not an acceptable camera
Reviews.Author: Real Raleigh Reviewer
Reviews.Content: To put this in context, we purchased this camera as one of a handful of point-and-shoots; we bought a Nikon D90 shortly before having our first child, which is a stellar DSLR, to add to an old Panasonic Lumix point-and-shoot that did take pretty good pictures, despite an excessively bright flash. After a couple of years, we wanted to 'downgrade' back to to point-and-shoot cameras, given that ours is about 5 years old, and newer ones are both more high-tech and relatively inexpensive for the given level of technology. We bought 'a few' to serve a couple of more or less specific roles, all shy of the DSLR's "big heavy super-high-quality photograph field cannon" role. The purpose of this one was to be... well, the cheap one. The everyday, easy-to-use, no-brainer, compact and lightweight and easy for my wife to put in the diaper bag and take to the museum or the park with the kids. Cheap enough that if you lost it or it got scratched by car keys, no big deal, nice enough to take good basic photos but otherwise no particularly fancy features.Now, put in that context, time for the inevitable 'pros' and 'cons'.Pros:- Extremely compact, lightweight, 'sexy' design with chrome details around silver metal body- Fast start-up, about 2.5 seconds to power up- Continuous shooting can get maybe a hair more than 1 picture per second. Specs list as 0.7s intervals.- Battery life seems to be good so far, about 200 pictures and several videos over the course of 3 days with all varieties of flash and zoom and the battery still indicates fully charged- Zoom is pretty powerful for such a compact cameraCons:- Skittish. It's hard to get a clear picture from the thing even with a steady hand. Image stabilization does nothing as far as I can tell.- Because of the former, producing sharp pictures with continuous shooting is pretty much hopeless- Focus is hopeless in ISO3200. No, with any automatic or manual setting, with or without the flash, focus is hopeless. About 1 out of every 4 pictures came out well-focused. Even focused pictures seem to have blurry points in the same range as other objects that are at the same distance, even near the center of the scene. This is even for things like city scenes in full daylight.- Abandon all hope, ye who shoot photos indoors... focus is abysmal. Did I already make this point?- Because the focus is so poor, zooming in on anything, even a little, is absolutely and totally hopeless. Taking pictures of animals at the museum came out occasionally reasonably focused; zooming in as little as 2x produced worthless blurry shot after worthless blurry shot- As with pretty much every point-and-shoot, the flash creates a scene completely washed out with white light - needs to be diffused.- Very slow to become responsive after a photo; with or without a photo review, the camera takes about 5s to become responsive and available for another photo. This appears to be the case with 3mp the same as 14mp. Just very, very, very slow.- Very slow to delete a picture; deleting a picture you don't like takes 3 clicks, then about 3 seconds to complete the operation. It's a little surprising how any device (phone, camera, gps, tablet, anything) could take that long to complete a simple operation...- The shutter speed is too slow or simply wrong; if you have kids, who are naturally always in motion, they'll be a blur even if they're standing still to pose for a photo.- Slow to actually fire a shot after zooming and pushing the button - sometimes 1 to 2 second delay, which means, the subject (kids!) is often simply gone by the time it actually shoots.- Grainy. Even in broad daylight, color fields on high-res pics, like buildings and peoples' faces, is grainy and pixellated with blotchy color tones.- Video. Can't record smoothly, even at lower resolution, with a high-quality Class 6 SDHC card. Don't bother with video.To be perfectly fair and objective, I took this camera and our Samsung ST-95 outside and took two shots per camera, of each of five subjects, in the same resolution, at the same time. I chose the sharper of the two photos from each camera and renamed the file generically. I then brought up the photos on our 1080p 55" TV - the largest-format, highest-resolution screen in the house. I showed them to my wife and asked her to choose "before" and "after", letting her know that I had swapped the order of the pictures randomly (so that A wasn't always the Nikon, B wasn't always the Samsung). In 5 out of 5 cases, she picked (and I agreed) the Samsung's pictures, simply on the focus. The Nikon just can't focus correctly. For example, on the back patio, the kids' tricycle is relatively focused, but the grill right beside it - both near the center of the shot - is entirely blurred out. All of my subjects were stationary out of necessity; I could not get a single clear picture of the kids or dogs with the Nikon, so there was no relevant comparison to be made. Using "scenes" to balance the settings made absolutely no difference on focus, only color balance.Overall, this camera is a fine solution if you don't expect much and you won't do much with it. You could shoot some video or take pictures of inert objects at medium range in full daylight and maybe one out of every two or three photos will be focused enough to pass a cursory inspection (don't look too close), but beyond that I'm afraid this camera just can't perform acceptably. It'll capture images, but they won't be GOOD. Despite the aforementioned purpose for which we bought this camera, we'll probably take around one of the better / other ones instead. It's really just about as well not to take a picture of those 'precious moments', as to attempt to do so with this camera. Other folks who have claimed that they are satisfied with this camera just can't be looking very closely at their pictures; after three outings and a few hundred pictures I am just amazed at how poor the quality of the shots are, in every environment, every light, every kind of subject. It's not for lack of use or lack of knowledge/experience with digital cameras; this really just has an extremely poor-quality sensor and processor and, I would assume, sub-standard firmware.I suggest looking at other entry-level offerings such as Samsung ST-65. Or, go for a mid-range camera. You really should only consider this camera if the looks of the camera itself matter a whole lot more than the quality of the pictures it can take - and, if the quality of the pictures it takes don't matter much at all to you. If you do care about the ability to capture images, this camera will not be satisfactory.I do not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: An easy camera to use for the average picture taker
Reviews.Author: NCBuckeye
Reviews.Content: I consider myself an average picture taker: trips, vacations, special events...I have been using this camera for about two months now and am very happy with it.  It replaces an earlier Coolpix model that I was also happy with, but did not survive a drop on a concrete floor.  It is simple to use, my pictures come out great and transfer easily to my computer for storage/sharing. My old camera required two AA batteries and they had to be changed frequently.  This camera plugs in to charge the same as you would a cell phone. I charge it before a trip and it keeps the charge the entire time, a big savings for me.  The zoom on this camera is greater than my old one which is a very noticeable bonus.  It is also slim enough to slide into a pocket, another bonus, and hopefully a way to avoid another drop to a hard floor!  I would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon is Finally getting the compact camera right.  Like the S3100!
Reviews.Author: D. Brinkley
Reviews.Content: I just got the camera, obviously...just came out this month.  I like the Nikon Coolpix S3100. It feels good in my hand and I love the quick button for the video capture.  A great thing Nikon added are the awesome filters.  You can add cross screen (stars), selective color/s and quick retouch. I've been wanting a camera with the selective color filter and now, my fave brand of camera, came out with it in the S3100!!! This camera is not a touch LCD type camera. I think the S4100 and S6100 are. More money..you don't need that opiton.  There are a few more features, but I like the ones I mentioned, the most.  It's fun,compact and quick start up.  14 meag pixels is a lot for a little point and shoot. This has more megapix's than my Nikon D90!  Love the HD MOVIES....I love small gadgets so I am real excited about this.  The S3000 I own too...that one is fun but not so many filters.I bought the black one! so,I would reccomend this to folks who want a small, fun and good picture and video quality toteing camera!

Reviews.Title: Replacement for my 6yr old Nikon Coolpix...
Reviews.Author: Happy
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix S3100 is great FOR THE PRICE! Perfect size to tote around; functions are extremely user friendly to toggle thru; just point and shoot; love the fact that you don't need to remove the battery to recharge; and it takes a great PICTURE!

Reviews.Title: This camera is the best point and shoot-out of three I've had
Reviews.Author: racer_41
Reviews.Content: Wow! Just an incredible little camera. This is one that the scene settings actually work! Took very acceptable pix in low light, 720 video is great. So far I've owned a Panasonic Lumix, a Fuji S70 and a Casio. This is by far the best.

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Yo "Yo"
Reviews.Content: The camera frequently takes blurry pictures.  Moreover, overall impression of cheap, cheap construction was confirmed when the lens cover stopped opening and closing completely within two months.  Highly unrecommended.

Reviews.Title: Not so great
Reviews.Author: Soyala27
Reviews.Content: I ought this camera in hopes that it would be as nice if not better than my old Nikon Coolpix L4. Yes, this Camera is thinnier, lighter, and more stylish but all of that's useless. The pictures would be beautiful if it wasn't for the horrible/complete lack of image stabilization. Most of my pictures came out blurry even with VF on. My Coolpix L4 takes better pictures and I got it back in 2005. Needless to say this camera is going back and I'll be in the market again for a new camera.And for those of you asking, I took pictures of still objects, people moving around on stage, people standing on stage (little to no movement), and my pets. Out of the 50 pictures I took with the camera I think maybe 6 or 7 were worth keeping. The camera did not do well either with the stage lights. (I am a theatre person and I NEED a camera that can handle the intense lights) Truthfully, I can't see how this camera could be useful for anyone but I see reviews that it works fine for other people. I ended up going out and buying an SLR type of camera and am quite pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Blurry Photos
Reviews.Author: Keverne
Reviews.Content: If you like blurry photos, this is the camera for you.  Every 3rd picture came out good.  Image stabilization - no, not really. I know how to operate a camera and this one is so poorly made it just doesn't work. What is even worse, is that on the screen, your picture looks perfect - until you download it.  Another item for the landfill, Nikon should be ashamed.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S3100 review from a mostly SLR user
Reviews.Author: Robert Cullers "RCullers"
Reviews.Content: There are a number of reviews here on the Nikon S3100 compact camera, but I decided to give my perspective on this camera as someone who has used mostly the much more expensive Nikon SLR (single lens reflex) cameras.  The SLR cameras are much larger than the compact cameras so they will not fit into my pocket.  This compact camera has solved that problem since it easily fits into any pocket so I can carry it all the time.The JPEG pictures are usually quite nice although some range to being underexposed.  There is an exposure compensation setting to that problem can quickly be solved.There appears to be no way to change the aperture on the camera to change the size of the lens opening as with a SLR so different shutter speeds are used to get what the camera interprets as the best exposure.  This means that shutter speeds can get quite slow in lower light settings so that pictures can be blurred if the camera is moved during exposure.  This problem can be solved by bracing the camera on a hard surface like a table or wall or by putting it on a tripod.Also to get the best quality picture images the biggest JPEG size should be used even though this increases the total amount of storage needed.  Graininess is an ever-present problem with these economical cameras with small sensors so the lowest ISO settings (sensitivity settings) should be used (around ISO less than 400).  Any higher settings than 400 will give grainy or pixelated pictures.A potential picture can only be viewed as a so-called live view on the screen as there is no viewing eyepiece as in SLR cameras.  This may not be a problem for some people, but it tends to encourage camera movement since the camera must be held out in front of you as you take the picture.Also there is no option to record the picture as a RAW file instead of a JPEG file.  RAW files allow one to adjust the picture in many ways in Photoshop or Photoshop Elements.  For example, the color temperature can quickly be adjusted from the RAW file, whereas, it is much more difficult or impossible to adjust in a JPEG file.Some compact cameras (e.g., Nikon Coolpix P7000 or Panasonic Lumix DMC-LX5) solve some of the above problems, but they are much more expensive (around $370 to $500). If these problems with the Nikon S3100 camera are not important to you, then you should be able to get many decent pictures as snapshots without messing much with the settings.  The picture quality should certainly be better than those obtained with most cell phone cameras.  I rate this camera relative to SLR cameras as a group as three stars out of five although the rating would be four or five stars compared to other compact cameras in its price range (I paid $110 for it).

Reviews.Title: Don't believe the bad reviews
Reviews.Author: Cliff Addy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with a little trepidation, because the bad reviews talk so much about poor focus, poor quality, slow transfer, etc.  But hey, I thought, it's for my 8-year-old daughter and if it's really that bad, I can easily return it to Amazon (a big reason we bought every gift at Amazon this year).A little background:  I'm a professional wedding photographer, so I know a bit about cameras and I'm picky about my images.  My primary cameras are a pair of $5000 Nikon D3s with $1800 Nikkor lenses, so I know what a good camera is and how it works.I didn't want to hand my little girl a dud on Christmas morning, so I just spent an hour or so shooting with this little gizmo, indoors, outdoors, moving subjects, all sorts of stuff and I'm quite pleased with it.  Is this the equivalent of a $7000 pro rig?  Of course not.  But I experienced none of the focus or other issues some people have had.  My only explanation is they had defective cameras or they're completely incompetent.  Overall, it's a perfectly acceptable compact camera.  In fact, I'm thinking of buying one for myself, it's way better than my phone in every way and I hate lugging my pro cameras to family outings (they're huge and heavy).My only "complaint" is that when I hook the camera up to my Mac via USB, it doesn't show up as a storage device in Finder.  I know some devices can be reconfigured, so I'll check into that later.  It's really not an issue, because we all use Adobe Lightroom for photo management and LR recognized the camera and can quickly import off it with no problem.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as I'd hoped.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 20 days.  If not for the fact that the store at which I purchased this camera limits me to 14 days for the return period, I'd have returned it already.  At this point I just plan to sell it on the secondary market.I purchased this camera based on the recommendations I found online, and also from a family member. I expected a relatively simple point and shoot camera with great picture quality. I planned to take it with us on vacation.  No special shooting situations (wet, bright, dark, etc...).  Just general picture taking and day to day activities.On the plus side, it's definitely compact and a relatively simple to use point and shoot camera.  It's quick to turn on and shut off, and seems to be pretty responsive.  The battery life seems good, the flash works appropriately, and the controls/settings seem pretty straightforward.On the negative side, I've got to say I'm pretty unhappy with the quality of the photos that I got from this camera.  I have an old Kodak C433 (4MP, I believe) that seems to take better pictures!Frankly, I'm astonished.  I've owned several cameras and never quite had this problem.  The pictures are either too dark or too light, and often blurry (both daytime and nighttime).  The colors are often "off", though that's hard to describe in writing.  I've tweaked the various settings without success.  I've used both "Auto" and "scene" mode, and also tried various flash settings.For the price, I did *not* expect perfection or incredible results, but these results were so poor that I believe even cheaper cameras would produce a better result.I'm the first person to blame the user (me) when I get poor performance out of a device like this.  However, I definitely have experience in this arena, read the instructions, and practiced heavily with the camera for several days.For the first time in a long history using multiple brands of digital cameras, I think I'd have to truthfully recommend that buyers look elsewhere for a simple point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Love Nikon, Hate this camera
Reviews.Author: Avid Reader
Reviews.Content: I received this as a wedding gift and took it on my honeymoon as my only camera. As a result, many of my memories of my honeymoon will only be in my mind, not printed in pictures. The shutter speed is ridiculous, taking 2-4 seconds to snap the picture after pressing the button. Often it wouldn't even take the picture when the button was pressed (took 2-3 tries with several seconds in between to be able to get a picture). No matter what setting I used, the majority of the indoor pictures are terrible. I couldn't get any action shots, again no matter what setting I tried. It would also sometimes freeze after taking a picture, taking up to 10 seconds to save a photo to the card (we think that may have possibly been the card, not the camera, but we can't be sure). Even some of the outdoor pictures didn't turn out- especially those that were under some time of awning or something and pointed outward into the sun.  I am taking this camera back and hopefully upgrading to a better one. Trust me- if you want your memories captured, spend a little extra for a nicer camera.

Reviews.Title: One great camera.
Reviews.Author: William Broschat
Reviews.Content: After reading several of the reviews that indicate that this camera is sub par such as "The picture quality is poor", and "The VR is useless". I was hesitant to buy this camera, but also saw some reviews that indicated otherwise. So I decided to make the purchase. I couldn't be happier. I normally use my Nikon DSLR most of the time, but wanted a small camera to carry while riding my road bike on Century, and other long distant road bike rides. The camera has been great from the start, and is very easy to use. The first time I used it after recieving the camera was on a Metric Century bike ride where I took about 30 photo's of other cyclist as well of myself with other cyclist behind me while riding down the road. In this situation it was diffacult to hold the camera still as I was pedaling and had to also pay attention to my riding. I was amazed at the quality and sharpness of all the photo's. I have since used the camera on several other bike rides and am just amazed. Of 100 plus photo's that I have taken thus far all of which were taken while riding my bike, there were only one or two that had some slight blur, and were deleated. This is the second Nikon digital point and shot camera that I have owned, the previous was a S220, and I think that this one is by far a better camera. Not much more to say other than this camera fits my needs very well. I think it is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Worst Point & Shoot I've Owned
Reviews.Author: M. Leotta
Reviews.Content: Got the S3100 as an anniversary gift at work.  I also own a Sony Cybershot point & shoot.  Both are poor for indoor shooting, but the Nikon Coolpix S3100 is horific !  Pictures & video on the highest settings with fully lit room are incredibly grainy.  The 720p video resolution is a joke.  Looks worse than old VHS quality.  Outdoors in full sunlight, I'm sure it's fine.  Overall, the worst point & shoot I've ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Issues with Nikon S3000 & 3100 original batteries.
Reviews.Author: Phillip Villaruel
Reviews.Content: Hi,I have had problems with 5 of the Camera batteries (including a previous purchase - original Nikon batteries). They charged fully a few times (no more than 4), then went dead and refuse to re-charge. The spare batteries I bought also had the same problem.The camera is good, but the batteries suck.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed!
Reviews.Author: e221322
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my older Panasonic Lumix. I am not a novice- just a mom who likes to capture pictures of her children on a daily basis. This camera was horrible. The pictures came out blurry and the lighting was horrible. This occured in the auto setting, which is supposed to do all of the adjustments for you. I returned it right away and ordered the newer Panasonic Lumix. I should have stuck with the Panasonic as it was always a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Maria
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my old Sony. The Nikon shoots great pictures and it's very easy to use. I love how slim it is and that I don't have to remove the battery to charge it. Overall a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Just purchased today and tested
Reviews.Author: Frank Milton "Frank"
Reviews.Content: I have to say up front - I was ready to go online to Amazon and purchase the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH25A. But I was in Wal Mart today where I saw some fairly cheaper cameras displayed. After 30 minutes of choosing between the Nikon S3100 and a beautiful blue Sony Cybershot cam, I chose the Nikon because it seemed to have the best quality at the lowest price.While driving home with the camera, I still had a little bit of guilt from not purchasing the Panasonic from Amazon. Then, before I unboxed it, I felt bad at some negative reviews about this camera making me feel a bit uncomfortable. But I said, I will learn and make the most of this Nikon cam and then go from there.Unboxing it turned up the smallest camera I ever held! It's like an iPod touch from 2 generations ago or like a fat credit card! The quick start guide showed me everything to get started (of course) and I will have to give more time to read the owners manual at the Nikon Website as soon as possible.Then the moment of truth came when I snapped some pictures. I was in the basement of my house where the lights are dim and I was only expecting grainy image shots. To my surprise the camera set on Auto Mode snapped pictures as bright as day thanks to the glorious built in flash! I even turned the camera on myself in a fairly poor lit area and not only did it get me, but also everything around me as if it was a halogen bulb in the room. I didn't even have red-eye. I could show the pics if Amazon made it possible, but please know I wouldn't type this much if it was any different.In closing, I still think about the Panasonic and all the wonderful reviews here on Amazon, but the Nikon S3100 has so much to be admired. The thin small size will be some getting used to. I only gave this 4 stars because, let's face it, I don't know everything about this yet, and at work, nobody gets perfect scores. It would appear like their manager overlooked something if they did. I'm glad I got this camera and can't wait to test it outside in the snow tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: Hundreds of photos and so happy with it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "indigoheirlooms"
Reviews.Content: As an artist I snap hundreds of pictures a week for inspiration, fun, memories etc. I am documenting my year and my cell phone camera won't do, my canon is too big to take everywhere. So this camera was perfect. I bought it in red and it is BEAUTIFUL! That's not why you buy a camera though, pictures and lots of them, is what a camera is all about.One reason I choose this is the macro lens my work is small and the macro lens was important. It works well. (included in images is a micro model of a ship). I also used the museum mode which makes pictures have a beige hue but it is not unpleasant.Food? well food mode works well when the lighting is off such as in a semi lit room or in fluorescents (included image)Clubs? perfect! The night and party mode really works well.(included images).Color options of photos? well the black and white lacks depth of film cameras but is ok. Vivid color is amazing.Zoom - Love it and use it often. (included image) It keeps the detail as long as the focus is rightFocus - always an issue with a point and shot and a digital makes it worse. This camera has pretty good focus. It works well for still shots, poses, miniatures. The challenge? if part of the picture is still and the other part is in motion. Like someone sitting but people moving around them. The camera will focus on on part. If you have it pointed slightly differently either the background or the foreground will be in focus, not both. Or if the background is really busy the focus will be blurred on what you don't center.Movement...ahh I haven't used the sports mode but I have taken a lot of action shots. There is some doppelganging if a person moves too quickly which is an interesting effect but may ruin a shot because sometime the picture is just a blur. Other times the effect is great. This is the same if you are moving (included image)Skin hues are good even on prints. Prints 4X6 come out well, however 8X10 prints loose resolution and come out pixelated. Horrible? no but not great. I would like the option of bigger prints.Timing...yours and the cameras. Digital, especially point and shoots require holding the shot for a moment. Not letting the subject or the camera move too quickly. This camera has better timing than my phone but not as well as my canon. there is a lag time after pressing shoot and when it actually captures the shot making it necessary to hold the camera in place longer than you think you need to.Battery life - Amazing! I shot 250 pictures in 2 weeks before the battery needed to be recharged. Pet peeve and huge CON - the battery showed full charge until right before it shut off. It went from full charge icon to half charge to shutting off in 10 minutes. The next day I turned the camera on and it showed fully charged icon right before it shut off because of a dead battery. So I have no idea when the thing is going to shut off. That is the reason I gave it 4 stars I have to charge it whether the icon says full or not.This camera is excellent for what it is. An inexpensive point and shoot. Yes you will lose shots, every camera does that. Yes the blow up isn't great a more expensive professional camera is perfect for that. This is better than the average camera in the $80 - $250 range. Use it for what it is made for and you will be perfectly happy.note: a famous photographer once told me the secret of great shots. Take hundreds and thousands of photos and don't be afraid of throwing out what doesn't work. The more photos taken the more you understand the camera and the more shots that be amazing.

Reviews.Title: Take it from me- DO NOT BUY THIS!!!
Reviews.Author: BB
Reviews.Content: I did my research last summer when wanting to buy a new camera.  This one had gotten good reviews back then, now it does not!  I have had nonstop problems, from the camera freezing inbetween pictures to it not being recognized when connected through the USB, and it has only gotten worse over time.  Nikon has HORRIBLE customer service, and is of no help, they fail to offer any type of real solution.  Also- this camera does NOT come with a memory card!!!  Save yourself the trouble and don't buy this camera!

Reviews.Title: Use your cell phone
Reviews.Author: kludge
Reviews.Content: My wife is a returning college student and we bought this camera so my wife could take pitures on her field trips.  I am utterly dissapointed.  My old Fujifilm 8MP point-and-shoot camera takes MUCH better pictures.  Most cell phones take better pictures.All pictures are grainy, noisy, color balance is generally way off indoors and out, and the flash only make things worse.  The zoom is slow and hard to get adjusted right... you always overshoot and have to pull it back, even just a quick tap overshoots.  The battery can't make it through a 6 hour field trip (less than 50 photos) even without the flash and even turning it off between pictures.I can't even recommend it for snapshots (which is all it was intended for).  We spent $130 and it was a total waste of money.Plusses?  It fits in your pocket nicely, you can zoom in and out while taking video (my old fujiFilm can't).Update:  I should have updated this review a few months ago, but I just remembered to post this.  It gets worse.  I now have the symptom that many other reviewers have had.  The battery is totally dead.  It won't take a charge.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jenn P
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera with great features. I'm very pleased with it. My only complaint is that on occasion the button must be held down for a while before it will take the picture.

Reviews.Title: Blur, blur, blur.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace one that was broken. The price was great, 14 megapixels, and it was a Nikon--figured I couldn't go wrong. Except... all my pictures are a BLUR! The camera has a very hard time focusing, so even if I'm taking a picture of a stationary object (i.e., my son when he's not moving), his face is blurry. If I want to capture a picture of him running around, FORGET IT! The pictures invariably come out a big blurry mess. The shutter speed is just atrocious. I've had other cameras before and never encountered this problem. It seems like a cheaply made camera with good marketing. I won't buy another Nikon point and shoot. It's gotten so bad that I've literally quit using the camera out of frustration.

Reviews.Title: Not a recommended camera
Reviews.Author: E. Brown
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera less than a year ago.  I loved it.  It was very easy to use and took great pictures.  Then one day a "battery exhausted" message came on when I turned it on.  I plugged it into the charger and nothing happened. Then as I was searching for a solution I saw that many, many people had gotten the same message and even purchased new batteries without solving the problem.  The company says the problem is in the charger, but you have to send it in at your expense and why would the camera still show that message?I am bummed.

Reviews.Title: I loved it until NOW.
Reviews.Author: Tara
Reviews.Content: My husband bought this camera for me last Christmas shortly after we had our first born. I wanted to make sure I captured all of our special moments. It was great! The battery lasts FOREVER. I think I had to charge my camera three times since I have had it and I have had it for over 8 months! It's really easy to upload pictures onto the computer. It's great for somebody who isn't all that great with electronics. HOWEVER, it used to zoom very good and have good quality pictures. Now if I use the zoom feature at all it comes out so blurry. I tried to take a pciture of my wedding ring and it just looks like a big whitegold blob! So, I'm pretty dissapointed. Also, it has been making a weird clicking noise? I have never dropped the camera or anything, so I don't know what is wrong with it. Oh and another thing when you press the button to take a picture, there's like a 2-3 second delay. It seems like whe nI don;t use the flash it's an even longer delay fro some reason and that causes all the pictures to come out blurry.

Reviews.Title: Poor image stabilization and color reproduction.
Reviews.Author: Crystal Ann Crown "Crystal"
Reviews.Content: For the price, this isn't a bad camera- but overall, within the genre of point-and-shoot cameras, it's definitely lacking. I bought this camera to take to work with me-- I work at a marsh restoration site-- to take pictures of the wildlife. It didn't really work out, so I returned it. This might be a good beginner camera. Maybe good for someone who isn't looking for much detail, wants something tiny and just wants to snap some shots of friends and the like. My two major complaints are:1. Poor color reproduction. I had to increase or decrease the saturation in every picture I took. Some colors would show up disproportionately bright and wash out all the detail (such as red or yellow flowers), and other's would be incredibly dull. The latter especially with colors that aren't bright naturally- it would dull them even more than they really were. Anything a pastel color lost all its vibrance. The only color I noticed that was pretty spot on was green. The greens were great, but the other colors not so much.2. Poor image stabilization. I got lots of blurry and soft images from this camera. If you were to use a tripod you'd get incredibly crisp shots. But, being that this is a super portable camera, that sort of defeats the purpose-- that being, NOT having to carry around something bulky. I took some daytime landscape shots that came out much too blurry, considering that I was standing still and it was daylight. On the other hand, when I held my breath and propped the camera against something to take some macro shots of shells, they actually came out pretty good. Expect that about 50% of your photos will be blurry or lacking detail, and the other 50% will be very clear. But even in the clear shots the color killed it for me. The end product is really hit or miss with this camera.The bottom line is, as mentioned above, if you're not looking for much detail and want something small enough to slip into your pocket, then this might be a good camera for you. Though I am sure one could find something for the same price that would give consistently clearer shots.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Cliff "Cliff"
Reviews.Content: Pros:This camera is small and easy to tote around. It takes great pictures in all lighting conditions. The video it takes is great too. You can easily start taking video with a press of a button no matter what shooting mode your in. The battery life is pretty good, it charges from outlet or when you plug the USB into your computer. It also uses the standard SD card. I suggest a SDHC card with a class rating of at least 6 for taking video.Cons:Very little zoom, in video mode. Specialized battery, not a standard AAA or AA battery. Macro mode is not close up.

Reviews.Title: Cannot give it more than 3 stars now.
Reviews.Author: Bighugeg
Reviews.Content: I will keep this as simple as possible.  Bought that with the Transcend 16 GB class six SDHC .  I finally understood that Megapixel doesn't tell  the  full story.  Set up for the maximum resolution, the pictures aren't far away from my old Samsung  which only had 3.1 MP.  The camera is very portable, but it doesn't perform as good as it looks , 5 X is great for an entry level camera.1)The camera is pretty slow with the class 6, I just ordered the Sandisk class 10  30 M/s  ; I was told by Nikon that using a non-approved memory card is the reason my videos are limited to 8 minutes, the approved ones are Panasonic, Toshiba, Sandisk and Lexar . I will find out on monday . After I received the new card , I'll see if the speed(time between taking each pictures ) improves  and then I will  update my rating.2)You can digitally zoom while recording video , but honestly, the quality get very distorted . Quite frankly, the videos don't look at all like 720P. My iPhone 4 shoots better.My conclusion is many cameras are much faster with a class 6  20M/s card  than this one .  My biggest issue is the speed issue, you might miss some beautiful shots just because of that and it can get you frustrated . If you need a fast shooting compact camera, well this is not for you , you might as well try something else. My dad used to tell  me that you get what you paid for, well he was right.  I am very afraid that I might just have to pay a little more . I hope this helps , shoot me a question if you need any informations.(update)I ended up returning it for a Canon ELPH 300 S and it blows the Nikon out of the water . The Nikon did do better  with the class 10 Sandisk than the class 6  Transcend I originally purchased  ,  but it didn't change  the fact that it cannot record videos over 8 minutes like the Nikon customer service told me.  I was lied to, so I ended up buying that expensive Sandisk. One thing I have noticed is the Canon is much faster out of the box to Focus  (keep in mind it cost about 85 to 90  bucks more than the Nikon ).  My conclusion stays the same, the Nikon s3100 is a slow camera, to make it decent you must go with a class 10 30mb/s SDHC. I wont talk about the HD video, that wouldn't be fair to the Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Very Economical and User Friendly
Reviews.Author: Mountain Preacher
Reviews.Content: This Nikon CoolPix S3100 was a gift for my adult daughter. We were very pleased with its ease of use and many user friendly features. One great thing is that it is rechargeable. No more changing batteries! It has sleek design and is packed with features. I especially like the wide angle zoom lens and the large LCD screen. A Great Buy!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Durable little camera
Reviews.Author: Chris Clare
Reviews.Content: I got this for my girlfriend for her birthday, and when you're a rowdy 20-something girl, things need to be durable, and they need to be worth the expense.Durability:  She hasn't managed to snap any bits of plastic off, and she's had it for about a month now.  For most other things she own, that isn't the case.The image resolution is excellent.  While most of her photos never see anywhere other than facebook or online albums, the image quality is excellent.  It's not the best for fast moving environments or really dark places, so keep that in mind when making your decision.All in all it's a good value for dollar, and I'd buy another one.  Nikon hit the sweet spot between quality and price on this one

Reviews.Title: Get a Tripod
Reviews.Author: Candice
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera for a simple point and shoot. The quality of the pictures are amazing but I have two warnings about the camera.1.) It has quite a few settings and options to play with. Might not be the most user friendly thing to people that expect it to work straight out of the box. If you don't mind a learning curve everything should be fine.2.) It's very sensitive to even the slightest hand shake and therefore has a high blur potential. I had to lower the MP quality to 5 so that I could take pictures in focus. Even then the pictures have a tendency to blur if I'm not careful. Buy a tripod if you plan on getting this camera. (This is why I gave it 4/5 stars...it's worth noting and at times it is a pain)Despite the bugs it's a very nice camera for someone on a budget that wants quality photos. I see myself upgrading in the future (and I'll probably stick with Nikon) but for now this will do.

Reviews.Title: Nikon continues its tradition of providing high quality cameras!
Reviews.Author: Avid Reader
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera that provides 'slr like' photos that I can use in my photography class. I've tested all the features (macro, portrait, red-eye removal, etc...) and they work as well as the features I have on my Nikon D100. SLR like camera in a PDA sized package.

Reviews.Title: SLOWSLOWSLOW!!!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I want to say that I like this camera soooo badly!  It's very slick looking, nice and small, and a good price.  The specs sound great...  I bought it because I wanted the 5x optical zoom that seemed at the time to be one of the better ones you can get.  I don't care so much for the 14 megapixels because, honestly, I probably won't use more than 5 anyway.  The files are just too large if you do.  I like that it has the dedicated video button.  I like that during the video, you can zoom in and out.  I couldn't do that on my previous camera.  That's about all I like.The camera is SO SLOW!  I can't take more than one picture at a time without having to wait for the flash to recharge itself before even showing me the display again.  Then I have to wait for the autofocus to work.  Then I can finally take the picture... if my kid is even still in the frame!  I have missed soooo many shots while waiting for this camera to perform.  Then the shots I do get are out of focus because I'm trying to chase a moving target that got sick of sitting still for the slow camera.I wanted to return the camera, but I decided to try using a faster memory card to see if maybe that was the problem.  It was not.  The faster card (30mb/s) made no difference at all.  Still super slow, blurry, etc... Now, still, I would like to return the camera, but of course Amazon has a one month return policy on electronics.  Not to mention that I'd probably get charged a restocking fee, if what I read was correct.  Maybe I can auction it off to another unsuspecting soul!

Reviews.Title: small but not snappy
Reviews.Author: brandeeno
Reviews.Content: i got this for my sis in-law. she says it takes way too long for the flash to charge, and even without flash, it takes way to long to be able to make the next picture (and it does have a fast SD card).

Reviews.Title: some good, too much bad
Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: Pics are good when the lens focuses. But I was shooting a lot of images in closeup and it keep changing the focus. Had to take 4-5 pics in exactly the same position to try to get one in focus. This is true of longer shots as well.Also, the tiny battery is very light weight, but it'll be out of juice long before you're done shooting in an afternoon at the zoo or whatever.

Reviews.Title: Love this little camera
Reviews.Author: C. Schneidt
Reviews.Content: This camera is cute, compact, quick and easy. Great camera for the price! It immediately recognizes faces and focuses on them. My  only complaint is that the camera took FOREVER to get here - over a month! This is ridiculous! I would have gone to Best Buy and bought it off the shelf if I'd known I was going to have to wait this long. Once it shipped, it took about 5 days. It was in a town 20 mins away for about 2-3 days! Not sure if this is because everyone is cutting back on personnel but things that I've ordered by mail seem to be taking a lot longer.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera!!
Reviews.Author: Cyn15790
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son who is in Spain.  I have not printed any pictures with it yet but so far its very easy to work, nice and compact.  Very nice for the cost!~

Reviews.Title: It died!
Reviews.Author: willK
Reviews.Content: It was less than a year old and it died.  I would not buy a nikon product again.  The camera would not work after a lengthy layover.

Reviews.Title: great very small camera
Reviews.Author: kelpy reader writer artist chef "kelper"
Reviews.Content: I have now used this camera to take about thirty pictures, in about four or five separate sessions, that I have downloaded and worked on, mostly just to crop. Except for the cases in which the camera warned me (twice) that it did not have a firm grip on a focusable-on surface, the results have been clear -- clearer than I would have expected and brighter, too -- given the relatively low indoor-light they were taken in, and this on "automatic." Well, it is a Nikon, after all.Having had wide angle lenses that tended to "fish-eye" I was really glad that this camera had a wide angle zoom starting at its widest without any noticeable fish-eye effect at all, creating very correct rectilinear images.As other reviewers have said, and I would say this about any good camera from any company: "Read the manual!"When I first got the camera, having earlier read the one- and two-star reviews, I was hopeful that I would not run into those kind of problems, though I do see that this camera is sophisticated and complex, and I did read the manual included on CD (and available at the Nikon site for free), and have found it a joy to use. Just as logical and easy as you would expect of a major brand camera.It is a small, almost tiny camera, and you do have to be careful with the USB-cable/charger flap, as it is small and might be delicate. But that aside, the camera operates really well, and I look forward to using it for years to come.I love its color, I somehow got a tan one, unlike any I have ever seen. Sublime.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: michele
Reviews.Content: I got this as a replacement for my daughters camera she had lost on a trip to new york, it is perfect we have had no problems and she is back to taking pictures daily.

Reviews.Title: Be VERY Cautious
Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: I needed a small camera and did reasearch on the cameras. I felt like Nikon was a trusted name but the thing siezed up on me after 15 pictures. I didn't drop it or do anything that would damage it. I did some more extensive research online and asked a few people I knew and found 3 friends that had bought the same camera and had the SAME thing  happen. Lots of problems with this camera for some reason. I returned it and bought a Lumix...sooo glad I did. THat is a great camera!!

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: curlygirl
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a while ago because I love taking pictures and was going to Hawaii the next month with my high school competition choir. I have had many canon cameras and loved them. They seemed to live forever. I thought this one would be fine though. I ordered it and it seemed to do what I wanted. I have had enough cameras that i am a fairly good photographer and I know how to take care of a camera.I had it probably 2-3 months before we left for Hawaii. I got there and before the day was over my lens broke. It wouldn't open or close. I never dropped it and it didn't get wet or get sand in it. I Had read other reviews where this had happened but thought it could never happen to me. I was in luck and one of the friends i was with is a professional photographer so I didnt miss the beauty. I still had warranty so I sent it in and they "fixed it". I got it back a week later and not even a month later the same thing happened. It still works a little but the shutter will not close all the way. I was really disappointed. I am never buying Nikon again. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: hate
Reviews.Author: Deoranie Beer
Reviews.Content: I got this last christmas, im so regretting my choice, i dont have a clear and clean picture, comes out dark and blurr, wish i gotten one of those with more pixels, my 7yr old son is now enjoying it since i refuse to capture my special moments with it.

Reviews.Title: after owning for a year the battery has repeatedly caused problems
Reviews.Author: fanofstr8
Reviews.Content: The functionality of this camera is fine.  The pictures are nice.  It has some great features, but having owned a Sony,a Cannon, an Olympus and this Nikon this would be my least favorite.  My Sony is a larger camera but the batteries are easily charged and exchangeable.  My Nikon battery is always dead.  Now after less than a year, the battery won't recharge and when I try the camera gets extremely hot very quickly.  I tried a second Nikon battery, and I'm having the same problem.  Batteries won't charge and phone heats up in a matter of minutes to where I don't feel comfortable leaving it plugged in.  Have a call into Nikon......disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Run don't walk away from this camera
Reviews.Author: Bobsyouruncle
Reviews.Content: Terrible.  Simply terrible.  Bought it for my wife and has not worked right from day one.  If you want a camera that has a battery life for five shots that take up 100 metabytes each, this is for you.  Everyone else, buy anything else and you will be happier.

Reviews.Title: Worse camera ever
Reviews.Author: jeramy81
Reviews.Content: Nikon should be ashamed of producing such an inferior product. Blurry fotos, hard to catch moving objects, takes a long time to recover between shots. Just plain awful, do not recommend at all.

Reviews.Title: Great Secondary Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: So for full disclosure, I am normally a Canon guy. I have had a few Canon point and shoot cameras and currently use a Canon DSLR as my main camera. I ended up winning this Nikon in a raffle at work and thought "heck, might as well try it out since it's free." I like it for the most part - especially as a secondary camera.My first impression was that it felt a little cheap. The shutter and zoom combo button is a little wobbly and the body is really really light. I have been playing with it the last few days and have been able to get some decent photos. Sometimes it doesn't focus very well, but I always use the method of holding the shutter halfway down until it is in focus and then press it the rest of the way to take the shot. In doing this, I can always tell before ever even taking the photo that the camera is out of focus. This allows me to release the shutter and try again.To be honest, I wouldn't use this camera as my primary camera. For the cost, I feel that there are other point and shoot camera that feel less cheap and take more consistently focused photos. However if you can get a good deal on this camera (or are lucky enough to get it free like me), I would say it is a good secondary camera to have. I like how pocketable it is (especially compared to my SLR) and will be taking it with me on those occasions where a SLR isn't so convenient.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: Cassie
Reviews.Content: While the price is right for this camera, I am not impressed with its performance.  I have yet to take a picture that is not blurry.  It has lots of settings, but none that just take a simple, focused picture.  I am back to using my old camera....

Reviews.Title: Poor Choice, S3100 has poor image focus.
Reviews.Author: Pinot Noir
Reviews.Content: I agree with the detailed review by A. Whalen also posted on Amazon.I owned this camera for a month and really tried to like it. It has a nice small size,looks good, a well thought out menu system and 14MP. And a 5x zoom range packed intothat small size with the Nikon name. Fabulous, right? Well not so fabulous after allthe testing I did.Who would think Nikon would have trouble with image focus??. They do with this model.I took about 150 images and used several focus patterns and then degraded the image to 8MPand the S3100 will only focus well about 40-50% of the time. I was confused for a whiledue to the difficulty of getting sharp clear images. A. Whalen's review helped sort itout, the problem is the focus system.I have a 4MP Kodak, 5 years old that takes clear sharp images 95% of the time. The3MP Kodak before that was just as good.So I returned the S3100 to the store and continue the search. This model is a black eyefor Nikon's 50 year reputation for excellence.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Dwight
Reviews.Content: Zoom (macro-tele) control is integrated into the shutter release button on front upper corner.  Makes it awkward to use this feature without jamming your hand over the lens.Also, too bad Nikon didn't use a standard mini or mico USB connector for the camera cable.  Instead they sue a proprietary cord.The camera is fast and takes good quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: 1st one was bad, but the replacement experience was great!
Reviews.Author: fonz_sXe
Reviews.Content: So I camera for my wife on Christmas. It work fantastic that evening, taking great video and pictures. I unfortunately found out over the next couple of day that it wasn't charging. Contacted Amazon and within a couple of days had sent me a new replacement camera with labels to send the defective one out. I appreciated the fact that they allowed me a few weeks to get the camera back to them. I sent it back and a few days later got confirmation that we were all good.Great experience with amazon.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Char
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from Amazon about a month ago. It is easy to use, and takes great pictures.  It also has a large screen for viewing before taking the picture.  It's a very small camera and fits nicely in my purse, I just love it!

Reviews.Title: coolpix camera S3100
Reviews.Author: chooch
Reviews.Content: This is the second camera I tried.  The first one, I will not mention the name) was not easy to operate nor did it take good pictures.  I returned it and bought the Coolpix and am delighted with it.  Takes wonderful, clear pictures, easy to operate and I LOVE IT!!!

Reviews.Title: Good everyday camera// UPDATE
Reviews.Author: P.R.
Reviews.Content: This takes good pictures, it's very small so you can easily take it with you, has the convenient button for hd video. It's a basic camera for those who like to take hassle-free pics.Update: It took good pictures, until a "lens error" came up, and now it doesn't work anymore. This camera didn't even last a year, and it got little use, and was super taken care of.

Reviews.Title: Takes GREAT pictures!
Reviews.Author: Java Jams
Reviews.Content: Camera was very easy to get started with - hardly needed the info on how to work it. Played around with the buttons in the back - easily able to do what I wanted to take pictures.  Has a zoom in lens - awesome for close ups that are CLEAR - even printing is clear when using the zoom lens.  Thumb drive included - only need to plug into the computer along with the computer cables (also included) and download the pictures to your computer and then can send to your cell phone.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: love it!!!
Reviews.Author: pamela alewine
Reviews.Content: i love this little camera!Works great and has great video and fits in my pocket so i can take pictures when I am riding my horses!

Reviews.Title: excellent little camera!
Reviews.Author: R. Monteclar "musicmaniac"
Reviews.Content: I have owned just a few cameras and the best so far is this cute looking camera, very easy to use and smart (gives me ample time to focus)and inexpensive, unlike some other small cameras that have confusing features. I'm no professional photographer and bought this one for my simple, personal use. If you're like me who wants less gadget hassles and pretty pictures, this camera is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Broke down after 6 month of rare use
Reviews.Author: Maria Chaderina
Reviews.Content: So disappointed. It looks good but apparently crappy on the inside - it broke down 6 months after I have bought it. I have never dropped it, no other physical damage. The battery would not charge. Now I have to ship it to Nikon (at my expense!) to get it repaired. And I am left without camera for a while...

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S3100
Reviews.Author: John Hinton
Reviews.Content: Well This is now my Third Nikon Digital Camera I have a D3100 and I had a S3000 COOLPIX which I lost at work. And now the S3100 which is an upgraded S3000 Which I liked very well but this one is even better it's yet to be seen how well it does as compared to my other digital cameras I really really like the size and weight of this camera it really surprised me when I first saw the s3000 and this one is the same size it's really small it's smaller than my cell phone and about the same width and weighs about the same so it's very easy to carry around in you shirt pocket. This model has a video button for quick access right on the back of the camera about the same place as my D3100's video lever is, quick and easy to use I opted of this model over the S4100 which has the touch screen. very easy to use and the Nikon ViewNX2 software which I already had on my computers is great with the Nikon transfer which I set to come up when I plug the Camera into the USB port and it's very fast I am using a 16G SD card and it works great this is what I use on my D3100 DLSR and I have about 3000 pictures on it and it's only about 1/4 full I take a lot of pictures of Graveyards for FindAGrave.com and this little camera is my almost constant companion I use it at work a lot and it's my backup and a quick cam to use at Church also very small. I had ordered a Panasonic Model about a week ago to replace my lost Nikon because the reviews were great and it was a top seller on Amazon, but when I got it and for some reason I really hadn't checked it's size and I said this is a mistake I picked the wrong camera this one is way bigger than the Nikon but in it's defense it did have a 16x Lens But I boxed it right back up and sent it back. Then ordered this Nikon S3100 Three Days Ago fast shipping indeed!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: brian
Reviews.Content: Best camera for its price ! It takes great night pictures, good sports pictures and just over all amazing with light. It even includes a basic photo editor on the camera settings ! The only thing that I don't like is the sound quality, but its hard to find a camera that's good with sound. Other than that this is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: It's just OK
Reviews.Author: danielle barnes
Reviews.Content: I returned this camera due to blurry images that it captured.  It wasn't worth the money or frustration.  I played with it for hours to see if I could improve it, but nothing seemed to work.  I replaced it with a Canon Powershot and love that one much more than this.It's not a BAD camera.  Has a lot of nice features, but it's frustrating to get the right lighting.  If you have a dark room, this camera is NOT the one to use to take pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix camera
Reviews.Author: reid
Reviews.Content: Great little camera!  Takes great pics, and is tiny enough to slip into your pocket or into a purse.  Bought as a starter camera for my 10 year old, but will use it as a family camera whenever we don't want to lug around my big one. I'm a Nikon fan!

Reviews.Title: useless
Reviews.Author: B. Closson
Reviews.Content: I to am a pro. (WOW we must be a dime a dozen)I took a pic of my wife 10 feet away in a room lit by 2 lamps.I would call this a fairly typical shot.On auto ISO it defaulted to 1600.On a D3 no problem. on a s3100 it has more noise than anything I've ever seen.Same scenario on a s6100.Again defaulted to 1600. Noise not as bad. Could get a decent 4x6.I tried setting it to 800.Picture was very dark.Outside may be great. Inside at night.......useless

Reviews.Title: First time I've returned a camera
Reviews.Author: Kitty Kura
Reviews.Content: I was very excited about this camera - it sounded like it had good features and on sale it was in my price range. When I got it home however, I found it difficult to get a decent picture out of it. Without the flash, photos indoors were very yellow - my white walls looked like smoker's walls. To be fair, I don't expect great indoor photos especially since the lighting in my house isn't that great. However, this was just too discolored. My old Kodak Easyshare C713 took better indoor pictures! (Which I only wanted to replace because after years of use, it will no longer turn on.) My other problem with the camera was its lack of focus. Close-ups were grainy or blurry. Even pictures taken at a distance didn't seem as clear as they could be.  I tried to take pictures of one of my cats in the pet mode and I saw no difference between that mode and the regular. On my Kodak, by putting the camera on the action scene I could get decent pictures of my pets. Not so with this camera. I paid $100 (which is more than I paid for my old camera) and I definitely expected more out of it for that price. I won't say stay away from Nikon (this is the first time I've heard anything negative about their cameras), but this particular model is not worth your time. I wish I had paid more attention to the negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: Not good for the money
Reviews.Author: S. Matteson "LvrOmusic"
Reviews.Content: Bought this hoping to have a good camera that is packable.  The small lens makes for so-so pictures.  The big topper is that I have had this for less than six months and the camera says "battery exhausted" and won't charge now.  I have tried different cables to no avail.  I read on the Nikon site that this is an issue with this camera and you will have to send it back, your expense, even under warranty, to get it fixed.  I recommend saving yourself, or gift recipient, the headache and look for something better.  I have an older Lumix DMC-ZS10 that has a larger lens and does a great job.  Not quite as packable but at least it is still working!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: walkeverywhere
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, it is compact, easily fits into a pocket and I love the "scene" feature that lets me get the best picture for the light.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: AWG
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed this camera. It is light weight and very thin, I bought for a vacation instead of bringing the much larger one from home, Very Nice.

Reviews.Title: It's OK
Reviews.Author: QUIteSmrt
Reviews.Content: The screen is a little small, making it hard to review photos from the camera.  It also takes a few seconds for the camera to reset itself after taking a picture, which is bad if you want to retake a picture.

Reviews.Title: Too Fragile
Reviews.Author: TRAJANO LIMA
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera, took nice pictures. Not outstanding ones, some blurry, other dark, slow to reset flash. Dropped the camera from less than 1ft high. It instantly died. I don't recommend this product; it is so fragile. Before that, I had a Casio Exilim (I still have it) and it has been lasting for more than 6 years, surviving tear, wear and drops. Now, I'm back to my Casio.

Reviews.Title: Not happy at all
Reviews.Author: Maria P. Johnson "Candy Sweet-XBOX360"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item in hopes of having a cute little camera to carry at all times in purse.  Well, the camera was cute, but the picture quality is sub-par.  My biggest complaint is that the camera doesn't have image stabilization.

Reviews.Title: Broke on the first day
Reviews.Author: Olivia
Reviews.Content: After carefully selecting this Nikon Coolpix, I was very excited to use it. I took several pictures and found no problem with it. It was easy to set up and use. A few hours later, a "lens error" occurred and it no longer worked. I kept trying to turn the camera on and off and nothing would work. It simply got stuck. Even before a whole day had passed, this piece of trash broke. This is the same problem that I had with my old Canon camera, but that lasted for 2 years.I am very disappointed with this camera and have already returned it. Thank goodness that Amazon makes it so easy to return faulty items. I do NOT recommend this camera to anyone. Spend a little bit more money and get a better and more reliable one.

Reviews.Title: Review of Nikon S3100
Reviews.Author: Norm G
Reviews.Content: I have a Nikon P90 with a longer lens, but I wanted a camera that I could carry in my pocket. The S3100 was just right. The focusing mechanism is very accurate and the camera is easy to use. The camera does not come with a memory card. Be sure to buy a Scan Disc card that has a fast speed rating. I bought a slower card and the video was very jumpy. The video was OK when I exchanged the slower card for a faster one. I was disappointed that it did not have a viewfinder. The monitor screen works fine, but a viewfinder works better outside in bright light. None of the new small pocket cameras come with a viewfinder. I am enjoying the S3100 and carry it all the time.

Reviews.Title: Definitely not worth the price...
Reviews.Author: L. Grassman
Reviews.Content: It looks cute and is advertised as being wonderful, but this camera isn't worth how much it costs. It's very hard to take pictures indoors or in any kind of even slightly dim light without them coming out blurry/almost indiscernible. Changing camera settings doesn't seem to help at all, either. I was quite disappointed by the film quality, too, something which was heavily advertised as being a wonderful feature: it doesn't look like HD and can only film a few minutes at a time. I do have something nice to say about this camera, though: it's great for taking outdoor pictures during the day. I've caught some marvelous shots of flowers, water, birds, and even the sun. But no, I do not recommend this camera to anybody.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this purchase!!!
Reviews.Author: Cara Widaman "Carebear"
Reviews.Content: What drew me to this camera in the first place was its sleek/compact design as well as its fun color, but after receiving the product I was impressed with how well the pictures that I took turned out. The only issue I have found is that when I zoom in on an object, it takes a few seconds for the camera to focus in on the object because it hesitates a bit; other than this one issue, it is a great camera that will fit perfectly in almost any size purse or pocket! Very happy:)

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix s3100
Reviews.Author: Ajinkya
Reviews.Content: Nice compact camera with almost all the features and works satisfactory but sometimes has problems in focusing. The pictures tend to come out blurry unless and until proper scene has been selected. Also it gives you an option of taking panoramic pics but it can not stitch the images within the camera itself/ You have to use an external software which comes with the package.My 4 yrs old Kodak camera could do that.

Reviews.Title: COOL COOLPIX...
Reviews.Author: Tarot Teacher
Reviews.Content: From the moment I opened the box and saw the brilliant purple of this camera I was in love.  I'm not a techno of any kind so how the camera looked was kind of important to me.  But it is a CAMERA, after all.So, I took some pictures.  And then, I took the camera to England.  What can I say?  Three weeks of absolutely gorgeous pictures.  Driving 50 miles an hour down the highway, in the rain, past Stonehenge and got fabulous shots.  No blurring, could even see the crows wheeling in the air.Love the zoom feature and the edit and save feature right in the camera.  Filled up two memory cards with pictures and loved that I could charge the battery from my laptop.  Still, the picture is the most important thing about a camera and this one takes beautiful shots, close ups, panoramas and short videos.  Even chugging along the coastline in a boat, the camera somehow stabilized the shots so no blurry, "what the heck is that?" kind of shots.So, why not five stars?  Well, my only quibble is that the delay time when using the flash could get a little annoying, especially when I wanted to capture a lot of indoor/nighttime pictures really quickly.  But that's the only complaint I have.  Great little camera.  I'm so glad I got it!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera but won't recharge
Reviews.Author: Cascade book lover
Reviews.Content: I was happy with this camera when it was first purchased ... until we tried to recharge it.  It would not recharge.  I thought maybe it was the battery so I bought a new one.  The new battery worked fine until it, too, ran out and would not recharge.  (This was not user error.  This is not my first digital device and I know how to plug in a charger.)After doing a lot of research online, I found I was not the only person who has had this problem with this camera.  Had to buy a third battery since I didn't have time to send it in to be repaired before leaving for a trip and the Amazon return window had passed. At that time, I found that the battery would recharge, but only if it wasn't totally drained.  Sent back to Nikon for repairs, but I had to pay the postage even though the problem was theirs.On another note, I also found that the battery seemed to drain more quickly the lower it got.  The battery would show  "full" for what seemed forever, then all of the sudden quickly be down to nothing.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Camera
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: Just bought one tonight at Costco and will be taking it back in the morning. Image quality is unbelievably poor. I took a standard and simple photo in my kitchen with the flash and it was grainy and blurry. Seriously, I've taken better photos with my blackberry. Don't waste your money!

Reviews.Title: All around Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Maria "Mariaa"
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a camera for quite some time now. Not some cheap thing that will just break, but not one too expensive that I can't afford it. This camera was just in the right range and has all the extra features I love.-Lithium Ion battery (rechargeable) A must for all digital cameras I buy.-scene selection- to automatically change the light and darkness and iso settings.-Filters- for fun pictures (black & white, fisheye, blur)-hd video (although I haven't tried it out yet, I bet it has to be good)All around it is a good camera and VERY light. I am actually almost afraid to hold it, that it might slip right through my fingers. I love it and I can't wait until I use it some more.

Reviews.Title: Gresat camera
Reviews.Author: Catang
Reviews.Content: The camera is super clear. I would definitely recomend this product to anyone out there who needs a easy great using camera.

Reviews.Title: Good out of the box
Reviews.Author: R. Raiz
Reviews.Content: I am not sure why there are so many negative reviews here. These are my thoughts -It has a small foot path.  And by that I mean that you can easily hold it in one hand, although for my purposes I always use two.You need to leave the battery in the camera in order to charge it.  No problem, although I would have preferred a separate charger base like on other cameras.  There is an indicator light on the camera that will blink green when it is finished charging.Picture quality is quite good.  The flash is very powerful, so it would not make the best camera for shooting in doors any object that reflects light, such as an album cover or LP.  Since I sell stuff on eBay this is  a slight drawback, but you can use a picture editor such as Nikon's Picture Project to minimize this effect.There is not a very long lag time as other have mentioned.  At least in my opinion, it is very fast, although not instantaneous.All all I am more than happy with my purchase, and am giving it to my wife to replace her Sony DSC-T200. I bought a like new one for $25.00.  Hope she is happy!

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Hurrel
Reviews.Content: I have other full size Nikons but this is one that I usually have with me on a regular basis.  It handles a lot of lighting situations very well.  It's a Nikon; you will not go wrong buying this.

Reviews.Title: For the money it should work better
Reviews.Author: Kevin J. Pollack
Reviews.Content: 90 some days after getting this the power shutter broke. The only why to use the camera now is to pry it open with my finger
