Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: laura wilson
Reviews.Content: great little camera. with some playing around and learning which settings look better for which things, it's great. great quality photos. very pleased

Reviews.Title: Great Video Quality
Reviews.Author: Ethan Bartlett
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for over a year and have used it for concert band video taping.  I upload them to youtube.  The product is very nice for a device that isn't a camcorder.  The audio is superb!  I highly recommend this! The pictures are also good too :p

Reviews.Title: Decent camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Annie Smith
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera to take on a backpacking trip through Europe.PROs: lightweight, portable, easy to fit into a small purse or pocketCONs: compared to a DSLR or larger lens compact camera - picture quality is not the best, lens got a tiny amount of sand in it towards the middle of the trip causing the camera to consistently malfunction until it eventually stopped working altogether

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX camera
Reviews.Author: bevandalan
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, this is actually my second one.  It takes great pictures and fits easily in my small purse.  The video's are also very good.  Highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: It's been 2 and half years since i purchased this camera and i must say it's almost as the first day, beside a couple of scratches, it works perfectly. I use it almost everyday, its compact size lets me carry it in my bag or my pocket! Very comfortable to carry and use and gives a great image quality, i can't complain.As the owner of a DSLR camera that i usually can't take with me thanks to its size, this little coolpix covers my everyday need to capture the beautiful moments of life.I recommend it to everybody that wants a compact camera but at the same time demands high quality images, better than the average over the counter compact cameras.The only negative side is the absence of a manual mode, but its range of auto modes resolve most of the photographic situations  we all have to deal with.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this camera. Cannon is far better.
Reviews.Author: eposner
Reviews.Content: Cheaply Made. Plastic. Terrible Lens. I think Nikon should stick to making Lenses.I do not recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: the gears of the lens, "jump some toohts", bad desing factory!
Reviews.Author: Miguel
Reviews.Content: after arrouns 3000 pic, the gears of the lens, "jump some tooht", and then i can not open it! bad desing factory!

Reviews.Title: Definately do not recommend.
Reviews.Author: Danielle Rice
Reviews.Content: We've had problems with our Nikon s3100 since owning it not 8 months. It basically will not do anything, now. When it worked, it was WAY too slow at focusing. My children were too fast for this camera.

Reviews.Title: You Can Rely on Nikon for Quality it and Canon are the best !
Reviews.Author: Paul R Skelton
Reviews.Content: You can't beat Nikon !  The camera I got used looks and works like a new one it does not show any wear at all. I usually use a digital SLR with interchangeable lenses but wanted a smaller camera I could always carry with me and this camera fits the bill perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Not so good.
Reviews.Author: Sebas
Reviews.Content: unfortunately it was not as expected. too much wearing signs and no charging cable included, it is expensive. Delivery took so long and no tracking info.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in this purchase
Reviews.Author: Faith T. Miller
Reviews.Content: not what I expected from Nikon. Too slow in actually taking the picture. Too many settings that aren't really helpful. Less settings that actually worked would make it much nicer to use.

Reviews.Title: As expected
Reviews.Author: Anup
Reviews.Content: Works as expected. Is quite slim and sleek. Easy to grip and take pictures with. Worth a buy and can be an ideal gift

Reviews.Title: Nikon Rocks
Reviews.Author: JKMA
Reviews.Content: Nikon Rocks...All my cameras are Nikon. They never let me down. Takes awesome pictures and the quality is great! Very slim to put in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Frequently fails
Reviews.Author: Lori
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift. Comments that this is not a point-and-shoot are accurate. Go to the Nikon website and read the instructions before you buy. I often have problems with blurry photos,off colors that look yellow or orange, too dark, etc. It seems to do fine on autofocus in daylight. Yes, these problems can be compensated for by adjusting several settings before shooting, but who wants to adjust the exposure and white balance every time they pull out the camera to shoot a kid's birthday party or pose in front of a landmark on a once-in-a-lifetime vacation? I go to events and see my friends shooting photos with their phones that come out better than this camera. Going to look for something else.

Reviews.Title: won't hold a charge
Reviews.Author: Judy Ingram
Reviews.Content: great pictures when I can get them. Batteries are Always going Dead. Replaced and Replaced again still no luck. I do buy the correct brand name batteries for this camera. Worst camera I have ever had

Reviews.Title: Made a perfect gift!
Reviews.Author: Michele Elliott
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift to replace COOLPIX S3100 that was ruined by being dropped in the sand. My stepmom was devastated as this was the only digital camera she understood how to use : (.  Nikon offered to fix at higher cost than purchase price?!?  Found the exact camera from Amazon used for $29.94 from seller Laredo CW.  This camera arrived on time and in great condition.  Can't beat the price...was totally amazed! Stepmom is one snap-happy lady and making up for lost photo ops : )

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Rochelle D. Adkins "Froggy Bottoms"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after having a Cannon PowerShot A530 for 5 years.  After I lost it, I could not find another one just like it so since I was happy with my big Nikon SLR, I went with this camera.  I realized that while Nikon is a great SLR, their point and shoots leave a lot to be desired.I bought the camera before a beach vacation and I loved that it fit in my back pocket.  It was sleek and slim.  But the pictures were always blurry.  I could not just whip it out and start shooting.  I had to stop, steady the camera and zoom in and out until I was sure it was ready to shoot and it was still blurry.  The colors were noisy and bland.  This was a while just standing still.  So I knew that taking this camera to a concert would be a mistake.  It does horribly in low lighting and heaven help you if there was any backlighting.  The zoom only made the pictures look more grainy.  My pictures all came out like a drunk had shot them.After two years, I began to think about replacing this piece of garbage.  This camera ultimately made the decision for me because now, it won't charge at all.  I only use my camera in the summer, usually on vacation or outdoor events so I did not get a lot of use out of it before it died.I will recommend Nikon as an SLR but I highly recommend you think about a Cannon if you're looking for a small point and shoot.  I also recommend you get a point and shoot that takes AA batteries!

Reviews.Title: Does the job
Reviews.Author: Lnd Svyr
Reviews.Content: Would buy again. No complaints. Pretty good pics. Haven't printed too many but think at this 14 MP would look great.

Reviews.Title: software issues....
Reviews.Author: Alex Ghafouri
Reviews.Content: I like Nikon...however this is my second s3100...and after a couple month of use...you get a error message saying software error. I would stay away from this model.

Reviews.Title: MARIBEL
Reviews.Author: MARIBEL
Reviews.Content: SI BUENÍSIMO ME ENCANTO,ERA LO QUE ESPERABA, SE LAS RECOMIENDO A TODO AQUEL QUE LE GUSTE LA MARCA NIKON, GRACIAS

Reviews.Title: Broken when I got it.
Reviews.Author: Gagagaga
Reviews.Content: This camera was already broken when I got it. I attribute this to it's poor quality. It was very, VERY lightweight which I don't think is a good trait in a compant digital camera because it just felt so cheap! And obviously it was. I promptly sent it back for a FujiFilm camera which I have had before and loved! FujiFilm cameras are great cameras and great deals!

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: jorge perdomo
Reviews.Content: I know it's not a expensive camera but i was hoping it would work better than it does. I think you can buy another one at the same price and could work better, doesn't take outstanding pictures.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Camera
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: Arrived intact and in it's original package - nothing was missing.  Camera works WONDERFUL and my daughter really liked it - not heavy at all

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: tess0720
Reviews.Content: Just a few months after purchasing this camera, we began to have difficulty getting the camera to open.  The battery was fully charged, and when the power button was pressed, the light would come on and make a noise like it was trying to open, but would not.  We have tried removing the battery and re-inserting it, but this does not help.  This has occurred numerous times, and we are now in the market for a different camera a little over a year later.

Reviews.Title: Trash, junk, garbage
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: Bought one brand new for my wife.  Took it out of the box, turned it on, the lens opened, then closed and the LED display said LENS ERROR.  Put it back in the box, returned it to the store and was told "We don't accept returns or exchanges on defective Nikon products, you have to contact Nikon directly".  So I went home and called the customer support number in the manual.  They said "This is a very common problem.  Just send it back to us, ALONG WITH $40.00 FOR SHIPPING AND HANDLING, and we will fix it. Throw in a box and a roll of bubble wrap at the UPS store and I've now spent $165.00 on a $115.00 camera and still haven't been able to take a picture.  I finally got it back from Nikon and it worked pretty good.  For about 2 weeks.  After that it refused to focus, and I threw it in the trash.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix s3100
Reviews.Author: Gary Telleck
Reviews.Content: Great quality and functions as expected from Nikon products. Purchased at a great price and picture and movie quality is very good in a small lightweight point n shot camera

Reviews.Title: Great camera...for a while.
Reviews.Author: Deebeaux "Dave"
Reviews.Content: I bought a handful of these for our business. They are used in the field by personnel to take pictures of job site progress. We do not operate in harsh environments. The cameras work well for this purpose and we actually need to turn the quality down on them to make the photos a little smaller for our purposes. As far as a point and shoot camera they have all been good performers. It's obviously no match for my Canon DSLR, but for the money spent they are good value. I think we have 4 or 5 of these S3100s in our fleet and one of the newer S3300s. It seems at about the 4500-5000 picture range the lens motor ends up failing. It sounds like there is a stripped gear in it. Nikon has repaired 3 of mine under warranty so far, and the 4th one is sitting here on my desk waiting to be sent to repair. This one has a lens motor failure AND the LCD screen is completely white. I'm not sure if it's a defect of the S3100, but these were purchased over a period of time in 2011 (September, October, November, April 2012) from Amazon.com and as of this week every one of them has failed with the same failure method (lens motor clicking/jammed/stripped gear). Nikon has been excellent with the repair process. It doesn't even require a phone call. Just fill out a form on the web site and send the camera off with a copy of the receipt and you're good to go. The repair process has been a little slow, but I keep an extra camera around for just this reason. At the price, it's cheap enough to do. The S3300 (newer model) that we have has not yet exhibited this problem, but it is a good bit newer than the others (purchased in August 2012). Only time well tell I suppose. I definitely would steer clear of this older model if you're just trying to save a few bucks. The newer S3300 can be had for less money on Amazon.com, but then again, I can't promise that one doesn't have these issues as well. As I said, only time will tell.

Reviews.Title: Quality camera
Reviews.Author: C. Rodriguez "chrrodriguez"
Reviews.Content: I bought this one refurbished for about 30 dollars and I an quite happy with my purchase.I would recommend

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Haruko
Reviews.Content: This is a great point and shoot.  Exactly what I expect from a coolpix camera.  I love that it comes in different colors.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: AB Commercial
Reviews.Content: Simple and easy to use. A no brainer. Many new products (electronic) don't make it simple. Nikon in this case does.

Reviews.Title: It's alright..
Reviews.Author: Gazala Buksh
Reviews.Content: for an entry level point n shoot.  video quality is decent.It does not capture macro shots very well, so spend more money if macro shooting is your desire.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Shauna Siino
Reviews.Content: Bought this  as a Christmas gift and my mother loved it! It's a great size and very easy to use!

Reviews.Title: Gift for my daughter
Reviews.Author: Rodney Castro
Reviews.Content: I bought it for her JROTC camping trip. She loves it and continues to use it every day. One of the best purchases for her.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann McLeod
Reviews.Content: I am a little technologically challenged and this camera is perfect for me.  Simple to use and even I can take great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Nikon
Reviews.Author: bernadette ombayo
Reviews.Content: I thought i had what i wanted unfortunately not, after using it for only a month i realized that any SD-card can't work in it unfortunately i had left the country for summer vacations. I am either unlucky with Amazon or i don't know what am doing.

Reviews.Title: product works great
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: very happy with product so far. works great. came when it was suppose to, in good shape.  happy, happy, happy

Reviews.Title: For the Nikon Camera
Reviews.Author: Shunkecia
Reviews.Content: This product met my expectations to the fullest. It came in perfect condition and I do not regret buying this.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Marielita
Reviews.Content: Camera repaired but in perfect condition. He brought all its accessories. Responsible seller and recommended. The camera is a beauty, very soft and has good image.Camera repaired but in perfect condition. He brought all its accessories. Responsible seller and recommended. The camera is a beauty, very soft and has good image

Reviews.Title: Sad
Reviews.Author: Thinking
Reviews.Content: Got this camera and thought it would be a reliable, decent camera for taking everyday pictures.First, it often takes pictures that are not focused properly, making them look like they are taken with an older, lower resolution camera.Second, the lens mechanism that extends the lens out when the camera is powered up began having problems working properly, the lens would extend only part of the way and then stop.Third, on sending it in for warranty service for this problem, they tried to claim that it was dusty, (it wasn't) and wouldn't even address the mechanical lens problem.  This makes a sham of the warranty, basically, their view is that if it is broken, it must be your fault, not a problem with their design.This will be the last Nikon for me.

Reviews.Title: Useless Camera - Blurry pictures
Reviews.Author: Sanjay Singh "Sanjay Singh"
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this camera. This is waste of money. I returned the camera after taking 7 pictures. They all came blurry.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jeninslc
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for over a year. I use it to take pictures like everyone else. I recently started making YouTube videos (today) and I used the video for this (duh). It has great focus and everything was great. The only complaint I have is after 10 minutes it automatically stopped recording and I didn't know that it stopped. I'll have to keep an eye on the time and go through my videos faster. Love this camera though.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Customer Service
Reviews.Author: crystal
Reviews.Content: The camera that was sold me is crap. Ive had it since Feb 2012 and am now having several issues with it. it wont charge/upload, i purchased a replacement usb cord then it said battery exhausted. purchased replacement battery. again it will not charge/upload pix. i am pretty ticked off. i was sold a camera that was listed as new and just recently found that it was USED. it had pix on the internal memory of people that i do not know. i am pissed, to say the least. i contacted 17th Street Photo before to ask about a replacement cord and was told "contact nikon" lousy customer service. DO Not BUY from 17th Street Photo [...]

Reviews.Title: Camera broke twice in a year and  nikon refuses to fix it
Reviews.Author: Cecile20010
Reviews.Content: First the battery would not charge, which technical support repaired for free (but we had to pay shipping). When I got the camera back, it only worked for a few weeks until a lens error message appeared. technical support claims camera has sand damage, which is ridiculous cuz i have not been able to use the camera since i bought it, let alone take it to the beach. They want to charge pretty much the same price i paid for the camera to fix it. the customer service has been very unresponsive. I am getting the camera back without repairing it. I am never buying nikon again.

Reviews.Title: awful camera
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: The camera takes decent pictures, but it very fickle. It takes 15+ seconds between photos to recharge the flash, etc. Don't expect to take pictures quickly with this camera. It was a great price, but an awful product. I wouldn't recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: preschool camera
Reviews.Author: Erin
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for our preschool based on the info Amazon had listed about the product. It had an entire section about how it was good to use with children as it can capture movement and has a relatively fast shutter speed. We have unfortunately been disappointed with the long LAG time in between photos. We are either loosing the children's interest or the "moment" has totally disappeared by the time the camera can catch up. The pictures it takes are good quality and print well but it is a bit frustrating to wait for what seems like an eternity between each shot.

Reviews.Title: It won't play video
Reviews.Author: Sally J. Riggs
Reviews.Content: I got this camera last Christmas and I really like the detail it captures. However, when I try to watch recorded videos on the camera, it lags, and then makes a buzzing sound. I have to remove the battery in order to start up the camera again. It plays video fine once downloaded onto a computer. And sometimes, the flash will blind out the object when I am trying to get a close up of something, but it's blurry if I don't use flash. Definitely better cameras out there.

Reviews.Title: Great until you read,"battery exhausted", on the display.
Reviews.Author: California Lift-Op
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera replacing a Kodak that had lasted over 4 years of snow skiing and riding wave runners. I received this camera and was happy at first. The still shots were crisp and the video was great. One morning I went to charge the battery and after about 1 hour I read,"battery exhausted", in the view screen. When I returned it, Nicon said it was from "Customer Misuse". It would have cost more than the original purchase price of the camera to have it repaired. Thankfully I had purchased an extended warranty through "Square Trade". They took the camera and refunded my original purchase price. I then purchased the Kodak EasyShare 14mgp 8X. Time will tell but the Kodak has already lasted longer than the Nikon Coolpix.There is a weak link in the charging system. Don't waste your money on this camera.

Reviews.Title: Waste of Money + Memories
Reviews.Author: ErikaRae
Reviews.Content: It was time for a new camera, and this one was my type: compact, point and shoot. Well, it's compact, but it's not quite point and shoot. The camera does not respond well to taking a picture unless it wants to take a picture. Seriously, it is not just me. I've had friends use my camera and they always remark at how crazy it is.Not only does the camera not want to take when I say to, but at least half the pics I take come out blurry.I just want a simple-to-use camera to take simple shots and not have to worry about them coming out bad, but this camera did not do it for me. The only thing it has going for it is its looks and size. What a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Broken one
Reviews.Author: lifegoster
Reviews.Content: The camera was broken after about 3 months. Sent it back to Nikon for repair. After 2 months, it did not work again. Do not bother to repair again for this piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Reliable camera
Reviews.Author: Pramod
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend to buy if you are looking something in cheap. This is really very good camera and give you very clear pictures and lot more features.

Reviews.Title: FORMAL COMPLAIN
Reviews.Author: Yamila
Reviews.Content: To whom it may concern,I would like to express my disappointment towards such a remarkable company.  I bought this Nikon Coolpix the one I am sending the feedback for, and it has been really frustrating to notice two things after purchasing it:1) The item has no world wide guarantee, which is unacceptable.2) Just a month ago, I tried to turn on the camera and it did not work. A message on the screen showing "Low Battery" remains on the screen until now. I did follow the instructions of the first charge, and did let the battery fully uncharge a couple of times. Therefore, the problem was not developed here, but it was sold defective.My disappointment and frustration came when I tried to contact your guarantee help desk. I started searching for a local store here in Argentina and all of them refused to provide service since the guarantee does not cover other countries than the few listed on the brochure inside the box. Today, I see myself compromised to send this camera to an outside service store, for which I not only have to take care of paying all taxes and taking it to the post office, but also trust on your word that it will be returned to me as new and the money I spent for shipping it for service will be also refunded.How can I trust on your company, if you do business like this. How come you not provide world wide guarantee and do provide such terrible defective items. I do not understand. At the same time I bought this Nikon, I took a Canon camera, and guess what, they do have world wide guarantee and most important it is still working.I hope you have a good answer for this, and encourage you to pay more attention on what you sell because this ain't customer satisfaction at all.Look forward to your answer,Regards.

Reviews.Title: Pathetic customer service from Nikon
Reviews.Author: Graybiker
Reviews.Content: We've had this camera about 6 months.  No issues with photo quality, but the 3-5 second wait between shots is just unacceptable. A couple of weeks ago the lens stopped opening when the camera was turned on.  We sent the camera to Nikon service and even though it was under warranty, they claimed the camera had "impact damage" (it's never been dropped) and refused to warranty the repair.  They offered to fix the camera for $102 which we rejected since we had only paid $99 for the camera in the first place.  You would think Nikon might offer an at cost replacement or some other accommodation to their customer.  But no.  Customer service is not their strong suit.

Reviews.Title: Absolute Junk
Reviews.Author: Tres Gooch "Tres"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Nikon Coolpix as a small camera to carry around in my backpack.  When it arrived I was mildly disappointed in the quality, it just felt "cheap", but I guess you get what you pay for, I expected something a bit more rugged. The camera takes decent pictures, but is painfully slow.Furthermore after 6 months the lens jammed and after returning the camera to Nikon warranty for repair, they claimed that it was impact damage and thus not covered.  Which was completely untrue, the camera was stored in a hard shell case at all times and never dropped.  I was holding the camera when the lens jammed while turning it off.Unless you want to waste your money I would steer way clear of Nikon and their Coolpix cameras. And do not ever trust their warranty.

Reviews.Title: Stay away!
Reviews.Author: Malyssa
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after reading some of the reviews. I will say that I do love the size. This camera has never taken good pictures. I've done some research, changed the settings, pictures still come out blurry. God forbid you have to take pictures in anything but bright light. Even with the low-light modes they turn out blurry. I haven't even had this camera for a year and it no longer works. I will never, EVER buy another Nikon camera. Spend a little more and get something with better quality.

Reviews.Title: What happened to Nikon?
Reviews.Author: Oren M. Powell
Reviews.Content: After loving two previous Nikon digital cameras, I turned to Nikon again when I wanted a small, convenient-to-carry-in-my-purse camera. I am so disappointed; I doubt if I will buy Nikon again; after reading the reviews for their current offerings, I think Nikon has just dumped its market/customers for this type of camera.Every picture is blurred; some are only partially blurred, which does not make sense. Even after adjusting the settings, all indoor shots have a yellow to red cast which is not relieved by using the incandescent setting. Most pictures are grainy. The zoom is ineffective and doesn't always work at all.I have taken many award-winning pictures with my other Nikons and the older film cameras, so I really don't think it's the fault of the photographer. When I read the reviews for this prior to purchase I assumed the bad reviews were just people who couldn't take a good picture no matter what, and I apologize to them, because they were right! I doubt if this particular camera is just a lemon, since there are so many negative comments from others.Bottom line: Don't buy this camera! And believe the reviews...ADDED: Outside photos are a little better, but since both the supplied battery and the extra Nikon battery I purchased for backup died after about 50 shots each, it's hard to get an overall idea---except that this camera is beyond disappointing, it's just a total loss.

Reviews.Title: unreliable camera
Reviews.Author: Scott Stoltzfus
Reviews.Content: Failed with lens error when needed. Repaired under warranty. Two months later also failed with lens error when needed. No longer under warranty. Absolutely astonished with the unreliability of this camera. Sticking with Canon. Never had a problem with a couple of them.

Reviews.Title: Sweet little camera!
Reviews.Author: Greg C. "Greg"
Reviews.Content: I saw this little camera with a really good price so I thought I'd try it and return it if I didn't like it. Well, this little gem won me over right away!For point and shoot it works better than the Sony I got for my wife at 3 times the price. In addition, its smaller, lighter, and the battery lasts forever. I charged it 2 months ago and it's still full bars.the macro function is spectacular. you can get really great close ups.The menus are easy to navigate and are very intuitive. I like the preset options and find them useful for special shots like nighttime long exposures.I can't think of anything missing on this simple, easy to use camera.

Reviews.Title: Overall pretty good camera
Reviews.Author: Canes5
Reviews.Content: This camera has a lot of good features...light, decent photos, good battery life, good video, nice screen. The only issue I have is you have to hold it completely still or you pics blur..no image stabilization unfortunately. Not quiet as good quality photos as my previous Canon point and shoots but I could not take dealing with regular batteries anymore as every Canon point and shoot I ever had eats them at a ridiculous speed. I would give this a b+.

Reviews.Title: Can I give it -1 stars?
Reviews.Author: S. Ozev "Sule"
Reviews.Content: I have been using digital cameras, all sorts of it for the past 20 years. I have never come across such a piece of junk...Where do I start?First of all, the camera itself does not work really well. It has a ton of modes (scene, portrait, face detection and focus, etc.). None of them really works well. 90% of the picture come out unfocused. Second, its response time is terrible. I have small kids. By the time the camera decides to take the picture, they have moved on. The only time it takes OK pictures is outside in the sun. Even then 50% of pictures come out of focus. I have tried all sorts of tricks to make it focus right, to no avail...As soon as it came, it started having problems. Two months into it, the camera would not charge. I sent it to Nikon for customer service. You have to pay shipping yourself even during the warranty period. Well, it came back with a note that they fixed it. Not really, I went out of charge again, and would not charge. I sent it again, they sent it back saying they could not find any problems. Really? I finally diagnosed one problem to be incorrect battery level indicator. It shows full until it completely drains and if you leave it be, it would not charge again (evidently completely draining battery is a bad thing).Lastly, the lens gets stuck. It is at a point where the lens isn't coming out 90% of the time. I am sending it one last time for repairs. I have already spent an additional $30 for shipping. I thought I was getting a good price on it. Well, not anymore...I would never ever buy another Nikon product. No matter the Amazon reviews. I understand that there can be sometimes defective products. But when there is one, you repair it right, or replace it. This is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: enforcer
Reviews.Content: This camera can not be beat for the price.  My kids have more expensive Kodak, Samsung and HP's with nothing but problems.  Will be replacing with Nikon Coolpix in the near future.  This is small enough to carry in my pocket on vacations without feeling like I'm dragging around a camera.  The cost on this model is also low enough that if by some chance it gets ruined I'm not going to be to upset.  Picture quality is great also with lots of scene settings to pick.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: smittypantz
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the Nikon s3100. My favorite feature so far is the 720 video. Takes good pictures in any light. Very compact easy to take with you any where.

Reviews.Title: terrible
Reviews.Author: deedah
Reviews.Content: Blurry photos .... bought this to take on vacation and have very few pics to remember that week because almost all of the pics were blurry. We thought you can't go wrong with Nikon but this one is junk!

Reviews.Title: Good for some events not all
Reviews.Author: Camille
Reviews.Content: Bought for a super good price and everything but it lacks some good qualities unlike some other cameras but like I said for a cheap price I'm not surprised. I bought it to help take pick of my daughters arrival so far it's good for up close subjects comes out super clear and really good quality but in other events( roller derby for example) it lagged getting good shots of the girls especially since we didn't have front row seats and they were moving alot but yea other than that it's a good camera just don't expect too much from it but can't wait to see how it turns out wen my daughters finally born :)

Reviews.Title: Good bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Ryan Berry
Reviews.Content: I bought this for just grab and go, idiot proof, point and shoot photography. I have to say I have been pleasantly surprised at the image quality and ease of use, especially for the price of the camera. The buttons, menus, and navigation are self explanatory if you have minimal experience using a camera. The only downside I would say is that the video quality, although 720p is not really anything to write home about. Although it can get the job done if you need to shoot a quick video. Overall if you want a cheap point and shoot for mainly shooting photos, and you are on a budget, I highly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Its just ok
Reviews.Author: reddyinfosys
Reviews.Content: This camera is good in terms of looks and but not in terms of qualityOne main drawback is that it takes 3 to 4 seconds to capture the image after you click, this is annoying ..user does not even know what is going onbasically poor response time

Reviews.Title: Huge disappointment!
Reviews.Author: GP
Reviews.Content: Nikon, are you listening?  I bought this camera as I've had a generally good history with Nikon products.  We bought a very similar Coolpix model for my wife.First, both have had their lithium batteries run down and we were forced to buy new ones at $20 a pop.  This is the SECOND battery in one year.  Nikon reluctantly sent me a free replacement when I complained that it was dead in one month.  We don't use the camera very often so for it to use up TWO batteries in a year is ridiculous.  It's like buying a printer and the company makes money selling replacement cartridges for the life of the product.  After 5 batteries, you've just paid double for this lousy product.Also, my wife hates the touch screen on her Nikon Coolpix compact.  We'll most likely dump both cameras in the trash and look at Canon or other models.So here we are, ready to go to a soccer match tonight and the camera won't even take a new charge as it's dead.  Don't buy these cameras!!

Reviews.Title: BLURRY PHOTOS except for bright sunshine.  Don't buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: DW in Astoria, NY
Reviews.Content: The only halfway acceptable photos you can get are in bright sunshine.  Forget cloudy days and anything indoors including with the worthless flash.  Nikon should be ashamed of this product.I miss my Panasonic which took amazingly clear photos until it got fuzzy squiggles on 75% of the images.  This started after about 6 months so that more expensive camera was worthless too.I've bought two cameras in less than a year and I can't trust any purchase now.  Most cameras are are made by a couple factories in China so we all get the same lousy product.DON'T BUY THIS CAMERA!  And good luck...

Reviews.Title: Complicated to Use
Reviews.Author: Steven Yerow
Reviews.Content: I bought this because it had the widest angle for a mini camera and a large LCD screen.  I have found it to be very complicated and always have trouble getting to the correct menu to change various settings or pre-sets.  Often get blurry pictures, but not always and am not sure why.Maybe more practice will help, but I use it only a few times a month.  The wide angle is very nice to have, tho.

Reviews.Title: Perfect, Simple Point-and-Shoot
Reviews.Author: Jaime
Reviews.Content: Preface: I don't write reviews. I'm the person who searches model numbers to READ reviews before deciding on my purchase (which I did before settling on this model)...That being said, I love this camera so much, I HAD to write a review for the next me who comes along doing product research...boy am I glad I didn't let the negative reviews sway me. It helps that I got this camera and a 4 GB memory card for a smokin' deal (found it on clearance and redeemed reward certificates at a local retailer; paying next to nothing), but I would have paid full price for this bad boy knowing what I know now. It is ready to use right out of the box (after inserting the battery of course), has a blazing fast shutter speed in "auto" mode (which is exactly what I was looking for), takes clear pictures without any fuss or blurriness (first picture snapped was of my Jack Russell jumping from the ottoman to the couch, captured him mid-air and picture was sharp as a tack) , and is smaller and lighter than my iPhone. I'm no Ansel Adams, bought this camera to take on road trips, to ball games, and for general random picture taking (and mainly because I'm a little paranoid handing my iPhone off to strangers in public when my husband and I want a picture together). Bottom line: great little camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Nancym8758
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my grandson's birthday and it is a great camera.  Picture quality is great and it is easy enough for an 8 year old!  Its small size makes it convenient to carry.  Overall, I love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: CINDY EPIFANIO "guerrooska"
Reviews.Content: This camera came very quickly. It is of a very good quality and I am very pleased I was able to get this color.  It was impossible to purchase it at any other stores.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Elaine "Red Sox Fan"
Reviews.Content: I replaced my old Nikon CoolPix when the cost to repair the broken lens exceeded the cost of a new camera.  I really like this one.  It's much smaller that the previous model.  It took a while to get used to taking pictures without moving the camera and getting blurry shots.  But as I developed my technique it was much better.  The camera sits in my purse at all times ready for photo opportunities.  I love it.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: angel
Reviews.Content: excellent camera, nice pictures. good  video, very  comfortable, good quality. la recomiendo. excelente camara, lindas fotos. buen video, muy confortable. buena calidad. I recommend

Reviews.Title: NOT satisfied!!
Reviews.Author: Dona
Reviews.Content: Beautiful camera and remarkably slim, but this product is not worth having. Pictures are blurry, especially when using zoom or flash indoors. I returned mine.

Reviews.Title: Battery doesn't charge
Reviews.Author: patriciamma
Reviews.Content: This camera is a piece of junk. I bought it for my daughter for Christmas. It worked for about an hour, and then the battery died. I followed the instructions to recharge the battery, but the camera had no power and wouldn't take a charge. I bought a new battery, new cable, and new power charger for the thing. When I plugged it in, the green light appeared on the back of the camera, and it charged up long enough for me to download the pictures my daughter had taken. Then it died again, and would not charge back up. A search online revealed that this is a common problem with this camera. I am sending the camera back to Nikon, but based on the experiences of other customers, I don't have much hope of solving the problem. What a disappointment. This was a total waste of money and time, plus my daughter doesn't have the camera she wanted so much. Nikon should stop selling this pricy, camera-shaped paperweight!!! Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S3100 14 MP Digital Camera with 5x NIKKOR Wide-Angle Optical Zoom Lens and 2.7-Inch LCD (Purple)
Reviews.Author: wearethesame890
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera to use for taking pictures of my jewelery to post for sale on Etsy.com. I ordered it 11-28-11 and received it on 12-7-11. It worked fine for my first use on a hike around my local park. the secound time I used it was on new year's eve. half way through the night the camera shut itself off. I thought it was simply the battery being spent but soon realized that was not the case. The shutter was half open/closed and the ligths on the camera were blinking. I tried everything to trouble shoot the camera but eventually it jsut completely shut down with the apature still stuck.I contacted Amazon customer service the next day and within 10 minuets on the phone with a very nice represtative they had a order in for my replacement. I was informed that I should return the broken one with the box form the new camera once it arrived.  So I waited...and waited. After a while of it being in the "has not shipped" status i contacted Amazon customer support, this time via live chat. once again a spoke to a very nice representative who advised me the delay was due to in being out of stock (I had ordered a specific color so I believed that to be the reason). I was okay with waiting further due to that explaination.The trouble came later after it had been close to 2 months of waiting and I again contacted Amazon for a status update. Again a very pleasant representative was there to answer my questions. My main concern was that the replacement order had disappeared off of my orders page and I inquired as to the reason for this. It was determined that the order had been canceled...the reason behind this? It was that they were totally out of stock with these cameras completely. Apparently the third party seller ADORAMA Camera was not able to provide Amazon with these cameras any further. I would normally not hav had a probelm with this had I been notified of this in any way, shape or form...but I wasn't. Not by Amazon nor the seller. Also after the extensive wait and the many times I was told that they were working on getting the replacement out to me, I feel that I was just being moved throught the system.I thanked the representative for his ground work and kiindness in the matter, as he did send out a email for me to print out a pre-paided return label and offer a $10 promotion towards my account, and proceeded to ask if I may speak to a manager.  My conern in talking to the manager was a few things:  1)To place a formal compaint against this third party sller and that Amazon not work with them further  2)The camera that I ordered was still for sale on Amazon, if so why was it that I couldn't get a replacement in another color.  3) A smple return for my money was not acceptable to me after nearly 3 months of toil and still not hving the product I wished, promotion or not.So I spoke to a lovely woman for a while about my concerns and after some time we came to a conclusion of my devising. Since Amazon couldn't provide my with a replacement from the camera I ordered, nor providing it in a different color, due to the seller not being able to get the product to Amazon (I WOULD STRONGLY RECOMEND NEVER BUYING FROM ADORAMA!!), I suggested that they provide me with a different model of the same camera that was stocked, sold and shipped directly through Amazon (Nikon COOLPIX S6100 16 MP Digital Camera with 7x NIKKOR Wide-Angle Optical Zoom Lens and 3-Inch Touch-Panel LCD (Silver)(http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004M8SVEI). The manager agreed that she would go ahead and do a one time replacement for this product for my defective camera and also place the $10 promotion offered to me on the price as well.In conclusion, this whole matter has been a wretch, but after everything Amazon was able to come throught for me and satisfy my order by providing me with a product and not just a return and a rebate, which I am very greatful for. The seller ADORAMA is the worst I have ever dealt with and I would warn anyone against them. My faith is still with Amazon, even if there was a slight waiver, and I will continue to shop and buy from them, while being more careful of third party sellers.

Reviews.Title: Broken in 34 days.
Reviews.Author: Gina L. Campanella
Reviews.Content: This camera took very poor quality photos (subjects looked like they were in a shadow or blurry) and on top of that the camera broke for no reason after 34 days.  I can't even return it because I am 4 days over the 30 day return policy.  I had a Fuji camera before this one that lasted for years but I thought I would try Nikon since they have such a good reputation.  I'll be replacing this piece of garbage with a new Fuji.

Reviews.Title: just not good quality and takes poor pics
Reviews.Author: GlowStarGI
Reviews.Content: This camera just didn't take good pictures.  The lighting was always a weird color and usually too dark.  Also most pictures came out blurry so we had to take multiple of each photo just to get a clear one.  The camera itself feels very cheaply made, which it is based on the low low price.  I feel like I will break it just by pushing the buttons.  Thought I could save $70 but it just didn't work out.  This will be going back.

Reviews.Title: I love this!!
Reviews.Author: pinkgirl5
Reviews.Content: I broke my previous Nikon and did not want to buy another (expensive, yet extremely nice) camera, so I settled for this one and I LOVE IT! It was the perfect price and takes fabulous pictures! It's small so it fits perfectly in my purse and not to mention bright so I could never lose it (except when my teenagers take it!). I would definitely recommend this camera for the average photographer (family outings, vacations, etc)

Reviews.Title: Great camera with a great price
Reviews.Author: Cheryl P. Williams "Cheryl Williams"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera with a vivid screen. It is easy to use, and super easy to transport.

Reviews.Title: just what I needed
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera after I had lost mine because it was the best price and had the best reviews. I like it so far, it gets the job done. Especially since I use it for travel, going out and whatever else I'm doing. Nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Douglas A Ingram
Reviews.Content: This camera is still a nikon.  High resolution and easy to use.  Bonus is that it also takes great video.

Reviews.Title: Poor Design
Reviews.Author: Walter Robert Stamper
Reviews.Content: The shutter button gets stuck so that the lens will not retract after taking a picture. When the battery is removed, the lens retracts, but immediately extends again when the battery is reinstalled. Eventually, the lens will not open or close completely and the camera becomes a throwaway.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error
Reviews.Author: Martha Drake
Reviews.Content: I will never buy another Nikon product again because of poor customer service. This camera had a lens problem from the start.  When I used the zoom, a "lens error" meassage appeared and the camera shut down. I sent the camera to Nikon three times for a repair and the problem was not fixed.  The third time, Nikon said there was sand in the lens and could repair it for the cost of a new camera.  I filed a complaint and never received a response from the company.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix s3100
Reviews.Author: Susan B. Holt "lib aide"
Reviews.Content: We got this for our daughter for Christmas.  She is absolutely loving it.  It came quickly and in great condition.  I would buy from this seller again.

Reviews.Title: I like this camera a bunch.
Reviews.Author: Razornoodle "Razornoodle"
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use because most of the functions in the menus are so well laid out you can figure them out without using the manual or dvd instructions. One of the best features is ease of movie making. The camera has a built in mic and I didn't even know it was there until I played back a recording of a local band that was playing. That tiny little mic records some very big sound. Great camera!

Reviews.Title: INTERESANTE
Reviews.Author: tomas mejia
Reviews.Content: TODOS ME LLEGO jente SERIA A TIEMPO BIEN SIN NINGUN PROBLEMA empacado Lo recomiendo CIEN POR CIENTOS ESPERO LA OPORTUNIDAD receptor Experimentado SIENTO DE VOLVER A COMPRARLE

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this
Reviews.Author: Mike Lynch
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras - one for my daughter and one for myself as a carry around camera.Both cameras quickly developed "Len error" and stopped working after only a few months of light use.The lens will not extend from the camera body - likely due to broken internal gears.These cameras were not handled roughly.They are just poorly designed & built.Additionally, the photos we DID get from from the cameras before they broke are lousy.16mp is a joke.Jpgs are of extremely low image quality and appear to be made of "Fuzzy pixels"Poor low light images.No raw available.I actually came across this opportunity to write this review while looking for the online invoice.Cheap is cheap.No getting around it.

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: Teapot Momma
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my daughter as a Christmas gift. She is a young professional photographer just starting out and she wanted to have a 'point and shoot' camera to carry in her purse. This one is perfect! The color is an added bonus. The pixel rate is amazing for such a small camera. I know she's going to love using it and taking lots of pictures with it. Nikon is an excellent brand of camera and this one does not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Great product and excellent delivery time, good performance and pricing, photo quality its enough and size really helps to fit any pocket to transport it and be ready to use it.

Reviews.Title: Always love Nikon
Reviews.Author: twinstar523
Reviews.Content: This camera is my favorite.  I have 2 of them and it takes great pictures and very easy to use.  Small, lightweight, handy and I carry it with me always.

Reviews.Title: Cute fun camera
Reviews.Author: J. Spencer "movie lover"
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera and I like it.I studied the reviews before I chosethis one. It comes with a handbook and an online owners manual.The directionsare decent and the quality of the shots are very good.Another reviewer had issues withthe battery compartment latch,but I have no issues with that.My only issue is the littletiny latch that covers the place where the USB cable goes.That could be a little better.There is a CD with a photo program too.I haven't used it because they recommend at least 2GB of ram. I have taken photo's and uploaded them with the USB cable.I tried sticking the memory cardin the PC but my PC said it wasn't formatted.The camera instructions said not to formatmemory cards on the PC,so I used the USB cable and that worked great.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S3100 14MP
Reviews.Author: Thomas F. Bock "roadduster"
Reviews.Content: This is my second Nikon COOLPIX S3100.  This camera is so easy to use, and functions perfectly for point and shoot situations.  Very small and easy to carry, and downloading is simple.  Easy to understand how to take the picture you want.  Would recommend to anyone who wants to push the EASY button when it comes to picture taking.

Reviews.Title: Blurry and dark
Reviews.Author: Camera Chic
Reviews.Content: I got this camera just to have a basic point and shoot for a trip I was taking and I didn't want to haul my D-SLR around. This was quite a disappointing purchase, and I had to return it. I did an involved test shoot as soon as I got the camera, and I'm not sure if it was just this particular camera, but it did really poorly. I did a test shoot of a single stationary subject, took a few dozen shots, and each one turned out differently and disappointing.  The flash was inconsistent and failed to light the subject properly in the majority of the photos. The rest of the pictures were blown out because the flash was too bright. It was almost impossible to get the camera to focus... it would appear focused in the view screen, but the picture was blurry. I loaded the pictures on my computer to verify that they were, indeed, blurry. I'm not really sure what this camera's problem is, but it was a waste of time and money to buy it. I love Nikon, but this camera is not good.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Factfinder "Factfinder"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, easy to operate and has nice features for the price. This version is updated from the older S3100 since the megapixel count is higher. I was forced to add more words by Amazon even though I said all I wanted or needed to say in one sentence.

Reviews.Title: Color is Off/Returned Camera
Reviews.Author: Texan Cowboy
Reviews.Content: This camera takes awful pictures at night or in low light. The picture looks overall orange and the quality of the photo is cheap. I returned it within two weeks back to the store.

Reviews.Title: Better features for the price
Reviews.Author: Keviv
Reviews.Content: I just got this recently and i'm happy with the picture clarity with so many modes for taking a pic and quick.Its better deal for the money..

Reviews.Title: It is great!
Reviews.Author: K. Hopkins "K Hopkins"
Reviews.Content: This little camera is perfect for me and my amateur photo shots.  I had an earlier version of the Coolpix and lost it :(  I had loved it so I wanted another one.  Someday I'd like to upgrade to a more expensive model but this one is great for now.

Reviews.Title: GGKATZ'S Review of Nikon Coolpix S3100
Reviews.Author: GGKATZ
Reviews.Content: This is my second Coolpix - dropped the first one while lens was open and jammed it.  This is a newer model than last one and I still like Coolpix a LOT!

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your time
Reviews.Author: H. Lakin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera during Black Friday sale at Target this year. It was on sale for $99. I didn't really read up on the camera or check out reviews but decided to give it a try. I've had it for almost a month, and  I'm returning it today. I'm not a professional by any means, I just wanted a nicer point and shoot camera. Forget about taking pictures in low light, forget about taking a good picture with out trying over 5-6 times, the LCD screen is very blurry and looks and feels cheap. While it is small and easy to take along, that is about the only good thing I can say about it. The only decent shot I got out of it was in direct light out side of still objects, so if that's all you're going to be using it for, then I'd say go for this camera. However, I know I can get a better point and shoot for around the same price.

Reviews.Title: Intolerable lack of focus
Reviews.Author: xi'an
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in New York after forgetting my old (10 years old) Canon first digital camera in a New York taxi... This was an unfortunate choice as the quality of the pictures provided by this camera is very poor. Unless there is a lot of natural light, the pictures come out dull and flat. Furthermore, as soon as one uses the zoom, the camera looses its focus abilities and most pictures come out fuzzy and unusable. The ridiculous number of scene options (landscape, sports, dusk, kids, pets, ...) is useless given the poor quality of the autofocus. In addition, it is unbearably slow, both in taking pictures and in transferring them to my computer. I do not see any reason to recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S3100
Reviews.Author: RavenzFthr "Joanne"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. A little slippery for my fingers, but easy to manage. The web page for downloading is still confusing to me. Trying to send it elsewhere for retrieval and saving. Not user-friendly at all. The camera fixes the pic when you look at them after taking so they are not blurry. I like it a lot!

Reviews.Title: ATROCIOUS!
Reviews.Author: eJud2001
Reviews.Content: Wow! Absolutely atrocious video! I did not know it could be this bad! The HD (720) looks like bad 320 blown up to fit a 720 screen!I will post my test vid on Youtube ejud2001 because unless you see it, you would not believe vid can be this bad!Still images are okay- but nothing to stand out from any cheap camera. Totally surprised what a disappointment this is! Wow.

Reviews.Title: Meh
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I needed something small and easy that I could use on days that I couldn't haul around my big DSLR as I had recently broken my older Point & Shoot. So when I saw this on sale for less than $100 I went for it. For the price I paid, it's probably okay but I give it 2 stars because I wouldn't recommend this to a friend and given the chance again, I wouldn't buy another one. Assuming that you're in the right light already, and that your subject isn't moving much, the pictures this takes are great. Outside of these conditions, this camera is pretty useless. The image stabilization on this is pretty much non-existent and it's horrible with lighting. It's terrible at correcting the white balance for indoor lighting and it picks up yellowish light where there isn't any. The flash is horrible too. Its too bright and has a tendency to completely wash everything out and there's always red-eye. Plus if you leave it on auto, the flash will pretty much always go off. It takes good pictures in the daytime and in natural light but beyond that not so much. Focusing is also very minimal. If your subject moves at all while taking the picture, it doesn't adjust the focus resulting in fuzzy pics. So now I have a bunch of pictures where I made my nephew stop and pose so I could get a clean shot of him, and his face is focused but his hands are all a blur since he is a bit fidgety with his fingers.It's okay as a backup and I don't mind letting the kids play with it but I miss my old powershot. Also, it bugs me that I have to plug the whole camera in to charge the battery. What's the point of a removable battery if it doesn't have it's own charger? I hate leaving my cameras out where they could be knocked off the table by the dog and then subsequently stepped on by the kid chasing the dog. I prefer it when I only have to risk the battery by leaving it out to charge but maybe I should be glad for it this time because then I'd have an excuse to replace it.I wouldn't rely on this camera to take care of all the important moments in life but if you're looking for something purse-sized for non-essential events this will work. I wasn't expecting it to take pics as great as my DSLR but my old P&S; from 4 years ago would still have outperformed this one. For the price, this would be good for a child or someone who only very seldom takes pictures but if you're going to buy this as your main camera I would skip it. Shell out an extra $40-50 for a better model.

Reviews.Title: Cool Pictures
Reviews.Author: Aw3som3Mom
Reviews.Content: Great little camera with 2 problems.  1) Did not come with Sim card; 2)Doesn't save to card I insalled.  Difficult to plug in computer cord as well.  Takes good pics, tho.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix Camera
Reviews.Author: Bet
Reviews.Content: I like the coolpix series of cameras.  I have had a few of them and given them to my grandchildren. They are easy to operate and take great pictures.  I would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Great Price (even beat black friday sells price of item)
Reviews.Author: Picture Perfect
Reviews.Content: Purchased camera for Father's xmas present! He is going to be so excited! This is just what I was looking for. Thanks Amazon for again delivering a great item!

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: misschynna2010
Reviews.Content: Im soo happy i orderd this! its soo amazing. its a good camera, battery is long lasting & rechargable so i dont have to go out and buy any.

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: lili
Reviews.Content: This camera ended up being a really great choice for me.  (The secret to it's general great functioning was that I put a Class 10 Card in it.  I did not have the lag in functioning that is mentioned in many poor reviews.)  Some of the other  negatives that I read in other reviews were very true (1.  it's slippery -- but I have little hands and once I got used to it I learned to grip it well (and I forced myself to use the strap); 2. it is hard to get a really good photo close up -- but I could live with that;  3. I do wish it had a zoom that goes closer up...oh well;  4) it is sometimes hard to get a clear photo, but with practice and trying different settings, and taking multiple photos --film is cheap nowadays-- I was able to get tons of really nice photos anyway; I also found that many times the flash washed things out too much).For a small, very light-weight, easy-to-use, reliable, inexpensive camera, this was a really great buy (in spite of it's drawbacks).  And I wasn't walking around guarding it all the time.  I used it and took about 7,000 photos on my trip! and it still looks/acts new.Also, I was able to easily video a swim meet in Italy that came out perfectly beautiful!!  (I attribute that to the Class 10 card.)PS:  I did not want the new touchscreen (just another thing that can break, plus I wear sunscreen on my hands, etc).

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Lindz
Reviews.Content: This is my third Nikon Coolpix camera and I love them!  This camera is lightweight and easy to use.  The different filter effects are fun to play around with and the placement of the video record button is so convenient!  The picture quality is great and I love that they also incorporated a "delete all" feature.  Definitely a great camera and the price is also great.

Reviews.Title: Russell
Reviews.Author: Russell
Reviews.Content: Camera showed up on time and was as advertised.  The ease of use and the clear pictures makes this a good product for the uninitiated user.  We've down loaded pictures to our computer with little to no troubles.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: Maddie White
Reviews.Content: This is the best point and shoot camera that I have ever owned.  It is easy to use, the pictures are clear, it's all-around very user friendly and very compact.  This was a very good Amazon purchase and arrived right on time to catch the fall colors.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Sharon Koleski
Reviews.Content: Great price, easy to use.  you will still need a sun shade for this camera.  Has taken great pictures for the price on two recent vacations.

Reviews.Title: Works great, takes great pictures
Reviews.Author: mdpadresfan
Reviews.Content: Used it on our trip to New Zealand. Took amazing pictures from standing still to moving in the tour bus. All round great product. Easy to use. Takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: seems like never give me any issues
Reviews.Author: Six Pack "Young Six Pack"
Reviews.Content: All my previous cameras have two commond issues. Battery runs out, I lost the camera and couldnt find it again.For this new one. I purchase their shiney red just to prevent the lost. They have so many color available. I can the color I like without worry about it looks girly. Since the color is so eye catching, I never forget to take it with me and its easy to find it in my house or car, you can never miss an red item when look for it. I purchased a red case on top of that.I had it for a few months so far, I did not use it as often, but I still did not charge the battery yet. Verus to the old one I had, it needs charging just like my cell phone. I am very please with what I got now. The slick look of it. I am beyond happy of what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Jordan P. Kaiser "J man"
Reviews.Content: I've always loved the user friendliness of Nikon cameras. The interface is what I expect to work with. I'm pretty happy with the product.

Reviews.Title: Great pics and features!
Reviews.Author: Isis
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small camera to take with me wherever I go in the City. Nothing too expensive and nothing too hard to use. My Nikon is great! I love the quality of the pictures and the ease of all of the cool features. Very affordable for the quality of the pictures! The larger more expensive Nikon cameras are of exceptional quality. The Coolpix S3100 does not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: great little camera.
Reviews.Author: John D Wilson
Reviews.Content: Only have had the camera for a few weeks,but I think it's great . It's easy to use small enouth to carry in your pocket. I am 73 and find that I can use this camera without any trouble. One thing to keep in mind is that it is small. Big hands and little cameras dont get along well. Even so I realy like it.  john

Reviews.Title: my review
Reviews.Author: brianthenum1
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Good battery life, great night pictures in the right hands, day pics are pretty good. Definitely a camera I would recommend but not at NIKON.com price.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: lverb
Reviews.Content: Exactly the camera I was looking for--great, little size (fits in a pocket) and takes wonderful pix. We were going on an Alaskan cruise and wanted something that would take great pix close-up and distance. This camera has many, easy to use, settings and took beautiful pix. Also, easy to use with no learning curve!

Reviews.Title: NIKON COOLPIX S3100
Reviews.Author: mamatoson
Reviews.Content: I didnt get to use this camera for a long time since we broke it :) but what ever pics I could get out of it, were excellent quality the response time for the camera is good between previews and the camera mode, honestly I only used to buy olympus cameras but now I nikon will be the way to go, and amazon's return policy is excellent if you are not satisfied ofcourse, so yes I would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Great little pocket camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Gaea
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent little point and shoot camera.  In addition to this little pocket cam, I also have a Cannon Rebel XTi.  As that camera is too big to carry around all the time, I often use this camera for friends' birthday parties, quick hikes, etc.  I have been surprised at the quality of photos this camera produces.  Occassionally, they are even better than the Rebel photos.  The touch screen is a great feature, and I like being able to scroll with the screen.  The memory card holds A TON of pictures.  I can go months without deleting.  The size is super convenient and fits in my pocket.  A few issues:  1 - You have to use your fingernail to scroll when using the touchscreen, it doesn't like finger tips.  Not sure that it would be of much use to someone with very short nails. 2 - I have not been able to figure out how to format the memory card from the camera.  I load all the photos to my computer, then delete the camera pics while I'm in the folder (on the comp).  3 - You have to charge using your computer or a USB port to wall converter.  There is no removable battery pack to charge (biggest drawback).  Overall, the value for the money can not be beat.

Reviews.Title: New point & shoot.
Reviews.Author: Juan el Americano "neverneverrand"
Reviews.Content: I used this camera to replace an older Nikon Coolpix 3100. More pixels, less bulk, decent features for the price. I had only a few days to get used to the camera before a trip to Mexico. It was easy to figure out and I got some very acceptable pictures to remember the trip.For the money and its intended purpose (easy, quality point and shoot fotos) I am very satisfied with the camera. The internally rechargeable battery is a nice feature and so far has done well holding a charge and taking plenty of pictures on a charge.

Reviews.Title: Nikon let me down with this one
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: I received this camera in hopes for a new camera to take to concerts. I love going to concerts and taking pictures, and my old camera, an Olympus Stylus 1010, has seen better days. Thankfully I brought both cameras with me otherwise I would have been infuriated. I honestly have never seen a worse powershot camera. No matter what setting or ISO I put it on, every single picture was blurry. I even put it on the sports setting and yet the shutter was so incredibly slow and nothing would even come out. The zoom is just horrendous, and on auto mode, the flash makes a person's face nothing but white wash.The only reason I gave this camera 2 stars was because the video is pretty decent, though I still had to mess with settings to get it to be that way. Do not have wind reducer on, then you just can't hear the video period. I had to adjust the brightness otherwise you couldn't see a think, and if you use the HD setting, make sure you have a HUGE memory card because my 2GB card only held about 6 minutes of video on the HD setting.I thought maybe it was just a bad concert camera. Nope, it's not so great otherwise either. I tried to take a macro picture of a lightning bug the other day. Wouldn't even focus on the bug whereas my Olympus focused instantly.I do enjoy the photo filters though, that's really the only thing about this camera that I do enjoy, that and that it doesn't take very long to charge this camera.I suppose you get what you pay for, but I honestly wouldn't even bother with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Purple Passion for Pix
Reviews.Author: CynthiaLuRN
Reviews.Content: Purple Passion for Pix~ so easy to use... so small it fits in my pocket, purse, hangs from my wrist... nice zoom! less intrusive... fun to play with & great pix!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: GinPat
Reviews.Content: Birthday gift for my 19 year old grandaughter -- she loves it.  Fits in her purse so she's able to take it everywhere --

Reviews.Title: Cute and perfect camera for on the go
Reviews.Author: Mrose
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a replacement for a camera of mine that was stolen. I did a lot of research and couldn't be happier. It's small enough to put in your pocket if you don't use a case. The battery charges in camera, but you can take it out in case that battery dies if you have a second battery. I absolutely love it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: aragua11
Reviews.Content: Great, the best undoubtedly brought everything indicated by the publication, is great quality, has exceeded my expectations. Great buy. From Venezuela recommend

Reviews.Title: Avoid this version of CoolPix
Reviews.Author: Heidi C. Crockett "kttopmom"
Reviews.Content: I had problems with the focusing mechanism of the camera from the moment I purchased it, resulting in consistently blurry photos. Those problems got worse and the optical zoom started malfunctioning.  The lens started sticking when I turned the camera on and off and worsened to the point I couldn't turn the camera on. The camera was still under warranty, so I sent it in to Nikon for repair. Almost 2 months later, I got the repaired camera back. The optical zoom works, but the focusing mechanism still doesn't work correctly. No matter what settings I choose, the camera has a hard time auto-focusing and many times simply can't focus on ANYTHING. The photos that I do manage to get are a little blurry and now they consistently have orange splotches on them, so now there's something wrong with the white balance or color management.I've owned other versions of Nikon's CoolPix in the past and really like some of the features, so I'm doubly disappointed with this camera. Given the other poor reviews, it seems like I'm not the only one.

Reviews.Title: Hilda, Colorado, smart camera
Reviews.Author: hilda
Reviews.Content: Hi! I just received this coolpix camera, I was so excited but had doubts that this camera won't not be as good because of others feedback but, i want to see for myself. Now I have the coolpix camera I took a lot of pictures inside and outside the house, it turned to be the best camera I ever have. why because this camera is clear and antimotion protection. there are so many scene of this camera, I like the subject tracking mode this mode, will stablized your taking the picture even if the objects move. Like I let my son jumped, and it turned it was not blurry, even if I moved my camera while taking pictures. And when you use this mode try to use the flash. So I think people say about the feedback of this camera doesn't know how to operate. You have to experiment it to get where you desire.  This is my first Nikon camera, so the quality and clarity is the best.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix s3100 review
Reviews.Author: TylerRoseberry
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. I was a little worried that i was gonna end up disappointed but it came in less then 48 hours with standard shipping. The picture quality was stunning and i was very impressed. If your looking for a nice digital camera, the Nikon Coolpix s3100 is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: Cute and perfect!!!!!
Reviews.Author: amyk
Reviews.Content: I am a non digital camera person.  TOO technical for me!This camera is a very user friendly and takes great pictures, plus it is very lightweight!!!!And with a company of Nikon, many years of great camera experience, you can't go wrong!!!!!

Reviews.Title: charger didn't work
Reviews.Author: Carlos A. Cotes Maya
Reviews.Content: So I got my camera, everything was fine .. Until I tried to charge it and surprise! The charger didn't work, I was so disappointed because I couldn't used it anymore since I don't live in USA and Where I live is not easy to find spare parts.. What is the point to have a great camera if you can't used when you need it?

Reviews.Title: excellent compact camera
Reviews.Author: Mark Butler
Reviews.Content: This is the third one of these I have bought, all for family members. I especially like the fact that the camera is rechargeable so no more batteries.

Reviews.Title: Takes good pics but some drawbacks
Reviews.Author: Joshua Hilsee
Reviews.Content: I took less than 75 pics on this camera before the battery failed.A week in, the camera gave me some weird error message that wouldn't go away unless I plugged in the charger. It also randomly switched languages and DIDN'T HAVE ENGLISH in the settings to switch back to.Nikon's warranty states that it doesn't cover battery replacements. However, I sent it in along with the camera and they replaced it free of charge.Pictures are good - about what you would expect from a point and shoot at this price range. I shot one photo while walking out of a hotel into sunlight and it bleached the photo, but it was actually a cool effect.Not really much else to say. Good for the price.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Customer Support
Reviews.Author: James E. McKinney
Reviews.Content: I have tried in vain to download a printable Users Manual for the S3100. I made 7 phone calls today to Nikon customer support, all 7 sending me to Nikon USA website. There is no way to print the manual. It seems to me they want me to pay for a users manual, printed version. This may be a nice camera but I am returning it for a refund. Should'a bought American.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel Batts
Reviews.Content: I have been needing a new camera for a long time and had been considering a larger nikon, but after seeing a friends smaller camera I started looking at those. The nikon s3100 has a great deal to offer in such a small package including a pretty decent zoom. There are too many features to mention here but the ease of use,excellent 14 mega pixel photos,make this camera a very good choice. I got a bundle price on a camera case that attaches to a belt and a 4gb memory card along with the camera. I paid less for all three including the shipping than if I had bought the camera alone in a department store. I would definitely suggest the s3100 to anyone who needs a pocket camera without a big budget.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy a Nikon Camera
Reviews.Author: VMeister
Reviews.Content: I had purchased the S3100 camera in June 2011 and it failed completely less than one month later in July.  I sent to Nikon for repair and am still waiting for it - over three weeks later!  I have been told by an independent repair center that average time for Nikon is 3, 4 or more weeks.I had purchased this camera for my daughter and is the first Nikon camera in the family(thought I'd give it a whirl).  Traditionally I have purchased only Canon and have been very satisfied.  After this Nikon experience I would highly recommend buying a Canon instead.  I once experience a flash problem with a Canon P&S; cameras.  I sent it off to Canon for repair and got it back in working order within 5 days (includes shipping time from NY to Illinois)!

Reviews.Title: An amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: stoil
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera recently and I am 150% satisfied with it. It makes amazing pictures and it also has a HD 720p video. This is perfect value of the money.

Reviews.Title: Impressive new technology
Reviews.Author: G. Quigley
Reviews.Content: Great little camera.  Takes pictures as well as any sophisticated, pricey camera.  We love the size...small, can be conveniently tucked away.  We like that there are color choices. Produces quality photos and operates with ease.  Can recommend this purchase without reservation.  We're not disappointed with the price or the quality.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this camera!!
Reviews.Author: sparko
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in May and by the first of September it was broken....photos were blurry and the lens wouldn't open. I took it to a service center for repair and it has been almost 3 weeks now. They said it is on "parts hold" and no one can tell me when it will be fixed. I asked for a new camera and they won't give me on. Their customer service is HORRIBLE. I have done some research and it appears that the lens error problem is quite common with this camera. So I have no camera at the moment and will never, ever again buy a Nikon product. Never, ever.

Reviews.Title: Died in 13 months, Nikon Coolpix S3100
Reviews.Author: D. Seymour
Reviews.Content: I had the Nikon Coolpix S3100 as a second camera and used it only 6 times and took very good care of it. During the sixth use it just died as I was using it. The lens would not come out and after recharging and trying everything I still cannot get it to work. It was past the warrantee by a month so I would have to pay a minimum of a third of the price, if not more than the full purchase price, to get it fixed ($29-$117).Incidentally, it is also a bit small for the normal woman's hands and can be difficult to hold steady as a result. I would not under any circumstance suggest this model. A friend who was with me that day has one as well and his camera was also reporting lens issues, although his still works. Stay away from the Nikon Coolpix S3100.

Reviews.Title: I Like It
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly very simple to use, and the picture quality is awesome any better and I'd be 3D. Lol! Only its curvature and front appearance slightly suggest it for a female, but that trivial in comparison with the upside.

Reviews.Title: Excellent price
Reviews.Author: julian
Reviews.Content: The camera is not the best, but it takes great pictures and 720p HD videos. I was surprised by the price and we have been using it during this month and I feel satisfied with the results

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera started having issues 6 months after I bought it. Lenses wouldn't open properly. A few months after that, it opened just a quarter of an inch, and refused to go any furhter. I figured out that if I pressed it in, it would extend fully. Eventually, even that stopped working. Yes, it had fallen on the ground on a few occasions, but that problem was independent of the falls.
